Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, noise from street, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: The40YearOldDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 kids. Great location - 10 blocks east of Pike Place Market, 4-5 blocks from shopping (Westlake, Pacific Place, Nordstrom, Niketown) and restaurants. Rooms were nice - clean, updated, comfortable bed, nice shower pressure, kitchen (everything but an oven). Water from tap in kitchen was cloudy - didn't taste or look good (which is weird, as Seattle generally has good water). Speaking of water, the workout room was completely out of water - I called, they said they'd send someone right away, but 15 minutes later and still no water. Workout room is open 24 hours/day. TVs built in to nice equipment (not the cheap stuff - I'm over 200 pounds, and I ran 60 minutes on the treadmill with no slip). They provide headphones and towels. The hotel faces the freeway - just above I-5. You'll hear cars and semi's all day/night, but it's not bad - I'm a light sleeper, and the noise was tolerable (more of a constant sound vs being by a bus stop or hearing sirens). The breakfast was one of the best I've had - kids and I loved it. Bacon was good, waffles were excellent, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice...all good. And all included with our room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “convenient/comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jim b
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites was a perfect place for our Seattle experience. The art museum had a Gauguin exhibit that was fabulous and a pleasant walk from Homewood. We also enjoyed a symphony very close to our hotel. The staff was helpful, the breakfast very nice and the room was great. The parking is a little steep but that's life in a big city. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy G
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center Pike Street was a great facility as well as location. They provided a great breakfast and free wifi with your stay. The 1 bedroom suite was great! The bed was great!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Guyfromfaraway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference last week and very much enjoyed my stay. The room is styled like a studio apartment - full kitchen, dining area, bath. Laundry facilities are offered, breakfast is free (and hot), internet is free, and the location is convenient to the the light rail, Pike Place Market and other locations. You should definitely stay here. I forgot to take photos but the room looks as advertised online.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: GloryConway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2012 during a business trip. I found the room to be large and comfortable. The staff was especially friendly and helpful. Whenever I return to Seattle this will be my first choice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: cabjohnson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here since conference rate at the Renaissance was sold out. HH member, chose Hm Stes over Hilton DT even though that was closer to conf. because of good reviews. Glad I did. Appreciated the extra space of a suite and the brisk 15-20 min walk to conference was good exercise. Breakfast, evening reception, and service - excellent. I prefer Hmwd Stes to the Doubletree Arctic where we stayed last time in Seattle (family trip). Convenient to downtwon and Capitol Hill area. Requested the "quiet" side after reading reviews and had no street noise issues. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kimCa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in downtown Seattle. This hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants and coffee shops and a short drive to attractions such as the art museum and the Pike Place market. My room was small (don't take a room ending in -04 they are the smallest) but really perfect for just 1 traveller. I think the other rooms were larger. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom small but updated with granite countertops. The best part was that they offered a free "heavy snack" in the early evening, including beer or wine, so I didn't even have to go out for dinner if I didn't want to. That plus a hot breakafst in the AM at no charge was certainly a bonus. There was a small sundry shop for snacks in the lobby if you wanted something extra. Beware the parking fee however. It is valet only at $32 a pop. I received a call just after check in to see if I needed anything which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel Option”
Reviews.Author: BPNYC_12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Well, kept, courteous staff. Only complaint is the elevator key card locks installed while I was there and the desk's inability to release it for a guest. I'm a former resident of the neighborhood & generally stay here when I visit. Great promixty to both downtown and Capitol Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience with a Hilton brand hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Tatti
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel in my opinion is very overpriced. I couldn't believe that others in our group who stayed at the W, actually paid only $10.00 more than we did. It was freezing in my room and because the hotels infracture is so antiquated, maintenance has to physically come into your room to switch the heat on if the guest before you was there during warmer weather. The hotel it's self looks pretty new, but according to maintenance, it's just "a pretty mask over an old and wrinkled face." And then the alarm clocks. I was there during the time change to daylight savings time and wanted to set both the time and alarm on the alram clock before heading. Well I couldn't do that because maintenance has to come up and do that too. I've never had an alarm clock where I wasn't able to change the time or ever had heating/cooling that required a strange man at10:30 PM while in my pajamas to come fix it. And don't even ask me how long it took for him to get to me. He left at 11:00 PM so I had to trust my wake up call which I surprisingly didn't get either. To top it all off, the Front Desk manager Dawnita, didn't even seem to care about my concerns and wasn't the least bid interested in her dissatisfied guest that beat me to the puch. I believe the solution to us both was, "I know it's frustrating but it's just one of those things that is what it is." WOW!! P.S.- Also I can't remember the last time I've been at a Hilton property that didn't offer on-demand movies and television. Even Motel 6 has this amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: sew0915
Reviews.Content: From the friendly greeting upon walking in the door, to the farewell by name, the experience was wonderful. Got a complimentary upgrade to a suite when I only asked for a fridge in the room. Staff always had smiles and hellos. Breakfast buffets and evening reception were very satisfactory, the latter a nice way to end the day before late dinner. My only complaint is there was no full length mirror. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Convenient, Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: RipplesGuy
Reviews.Content: I'll admit I was a bit nervous when I looked at the location on the map because I feared it would be a noisy location right on Pike Street next to the interstate. I requested a quiet room and they found me a room on the courtyard side that was just fantastic. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and during my 4-day stay they frequently greeted me and inquired about my adventures about town. They were quick to answer questions and accommodate a few requests. They even provided SUNSHINE on a couple of days (oh wait, that may not be able to take credit for that....). The location was excellent. I was able to take the light rail from the airport (40 minute ride for under $3? yes please), and then walk 5-6 blocks to the hotel. I rented a car one day from the Hertz counter a block away, and jumping on the interstate was a breeze. The iconic Pike Street Market is an 8 block walk down the hill, and if you walk a few blocks east you're in the heart of the Capitol Hill District with all kinds of food and shopping. The convention center is located next door, and a very unique urban park built over the interstate provides a fantastic place to escape is integrated into the landscape with remarkable precision. A delightful bonus that I enjoyed several times. If you aren't familiar with the Homewood Suites brand, not only do they serve a hot breakfast but also a light dinner Monday-Thursday evenings that is a great deal especially for weary business travelers who might not feel like venturing out at the end of a long day. One last thing for people who ARE familiar with the Homewood Suites brand. Many of the properties I've stayed at have a more "country home" feel to them in terms of decor and layout..this place is very classy and reminded me more of their "Hilton Garden Inn" sister brand within the Hilton brand family.

Reviews.Title: “not one complaint”
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel B
Reviews.Content: Very clean, polite staff, decent food, comfortable beds, big bathrooms. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I travel a lot for work and this is one of the better hotels I have had the pleasure to stay in and I got it for the Per Diem rate. Parking is a bit pricey but so is all other parking down town and its valet only. I stayed in a king suite and the room was very comfortable in every way so its perfect for extended stays.

Reviews.Title: “719, Fireplace”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: This room faces the courtyard and is very quiet. The fireplace is very pretty but we couldn't get anything other than the flame of the pilot light to work. I did mention this at check out. The bath in this room is huge, the largest of any of the rooms that we have had in this hotel. There is a very tall shower head in room 618 and we had requested this room in advance and confirmed it with a phone call the day before our stay. We were given 719 on check in instead and decided to explore this side of the hotel. We have been on the street side and with the door open, it is noisy but fine with it shut. We have been on the side street, which had the best balcony of all the rooms. This room has a tiny balcony and essentially no view, only of the small court yard and the apartment next door. It was necessary to keep the curtains closed because we concluded that if we could see the people in the apartments, they could see us as well. This is the first time I have been disappointed with the breakfast. There is usually some type of egg dish and this was a breakfast burrito. I am not a picky eater, but the burrito was dried out, the wrapper crispy and the sausage and egg mixture was greasy and inedible. I gave up after several bites and had the hard boiled eggs and a banana. The coffee is consistently good and I love the flavored creamer as an option. The location of this hotel and the ease of walking everywhere downtown and to the train station for the ride to the airport is the main attraction for me. I will be happy to stay again and would love to see the 9th floor next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: Checked in about noon with no problems. Reception staff were courteous, nice but rather small lobby. I'm a Hilton Honors member, which I highly reccommend you join before staying at any Hilton property as they go out ot their way to put you in the best available room. They put me on the top floor with a great view of Seattle. The room was very nice and clean with a full sized refrigerator, dishwasher, two burner stove, and microwave. Also a sofa, desk with special ergonomic chair. and a very sizable room. There is also a very large closet that has it's own lighting. You can basically walk in to the closet to put your luggage. 32" LG flat panel tv, very comfortable bed, nice linens, and GREAT pillows. I only stayed one night, but if I stay in downtown Seattle again, this will definitely be on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: byby-traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I am in Seattle for business as it is a solid hotel. Friendly staff, large rooms, good breakfast in the morning and snacks & beer/wine in the evening. The room was very clean and everything worked as expected. Housekeeping did a very good job with one very minor exception - each time they left the bathroom drinking glass that had been used. The newspaper was sometimes was left by the door in the morning and sometimes it was not, so it was inconsistent throughout the week. I didn't receive a bill under the door the morning of checkout but the front desk printed one at checkout. The Convention Center is next door and the location is an easy walk to downtown and Pike Market. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth stay”
Reviews.Author: NCLimey
Reviews.Content: I think that the parking, after tax (and valet tips) was more expensive than the expensive downtown Washington DC Hilton/HGI. Friendly Staff. Somewhat convoluted hhonors floor where you need to take an elevator up, then walk to another elevator that goes up one more floor, it's a bit like being punished for having status if you're wheeling baggage/equipment around. The room was nice, though there was a large gap at the bottom of the door that let a lot of noise in from the corridor - there's always that one guy who has to use his outside voice in a hotel corridor after 11pm I liked that the TV signal was in HD and I was glad that I got a courtyard view as the other side seemed very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Just ask for a courtside room”
Reviews.Author: cariboukb
Reviews.Content: This is a great property, new, so everything is up to Hilton Standards. Rooms are suites, and are very comfortable and nicely appointed. If you need to be in the area of the Convention Center, this is a great place to stay. The only downsides that I have experienced (and I stay here a couple of times a year on business) are the Welcome Home Reception -- skip it. The food is bland and you don't have any really healthy choices. And, ask for a courtside room. The rooms in the front...I-5 goes under the hotel, and there is always traffic noise. If you get on the west side of the property (Boren) the street is constantly busy and is a major avenue for emergency vehicles, so you get sirens all times of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: bidyut_tamuly
Reviews.Content: Spacious suites; value for money; very close to the convention center, walking distance to most of the attractions in Seattle Downtown; pike place is straight down the road; the buffet breakfast and evening manager's reception is not great but keeping the cost in view it was OK. only disadvantage is the humming noise coming from cars running in the highway nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, plenty of room and good location.”
Reviews.Author: KadySanClemente_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 2 blocks from the Convention Center, centrally located. All rooms are suites with mini kitchens. Rooms were very comfortable, onsite laundry was also a plus. They serve daily breakfast and evening drinks with light dinner Monday - Thursday. Staff was very helpful. Would definitely stay there next time we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice run of the mill stay,better for a few days than 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: siebie22
Reviews.Content: This is a neat hotel , very well placed and close to the downtown core. Nothing spectacular,but the best priced over our New Year's eve in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: deslaw
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Residence Inn user and once and a while I try the competitors brand. Nothjing changed my mind here, from the moment we arrived the staff seemeed indifferent: Complimentary light meal 5-7pm, half of the food selection was gone by 6pm Advertised pool was open and I also confirmed by phone, when I arrived the pool temparature was 70 and hotub 90 and their was a note on the wall that the pool was not officially opened till June? I paid $183 plus tax for 2 queens and a pull out and parking, not worth it for this property. If you need to stay downtown and in walking distance spend the extra bucks and stay at a 4 star (Sheraton is a good choice) otherwise stay out out much nicer properties like the Resdience Inn in Redmond or courtyard in Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay in downtown Seattle this weekend. Check in was easy and the room was great. The parking guys and front desk were very helpful. The breakfast was just okay, but hey, it was free. We were on the 6th floor and both my husband and I noticed a smell in the hallway. Didn't effect our room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for downtown location (and almost includes dinner)”
Reviews.Author: Kalb_al_Akrab
Reviews.Content: I'm a local but every time my extended family visits they stay here and I stay with them for two reasons: location and value. Right in the middle of Downtown and Capitol Hill, on the bus line, just several blocks from Pike Place Market (the hotel is on Pike St); the location is prime for the price. We booked the 2 Queen 1BR Suite this time and it came with a kitchenette with a simple but sufficient set of appliances. Breakfast is varied and good, with different egg dishes and meat options daily. Welcome home reception offered on weekdays is essentially in-house light dinner (wine included). While it's served quite early for a supper and the menu is ordinary, it is over & beyond expectation for what's complimentary and just adds to the value of this hotel. Parking is pricey but street pay-at-station parking is also an option if you are willing to look around. The hotel arranges flat-fare cab service to the Seatac airport, and while I don't know how the rate compares to the average downtown-airport one way fare, they have always been reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LuViPortland
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at three other downtown Seattle properties and two in the U District. Homewood Suites by Hilton Seattle Convention Center is in the best location outside the U District, and we'd never stay anywhere else. Anthony in the reception gave a warm, but not overdone greeting, and everyone else was just as competent. The valets are amazing. Parking costs plenty, $32.00/night plus tax & tip, but after paying twice that in Oslo, it seems like a bargain. Breakfast offers several choices and even includes walnuts and fresh fruit. There is an included Monday through Thursday Welcome Home dinner that is more than adequate, even serving wine and beer along with a complete meal in the very pleasant dining rooms. The heating system is strange. We like to sleep in a cold room, but could not adjust the temperature and did not have time to ask staff to help. We did request someone to fix the commode which was broken before we took the room. They sent someone, and called to check that it'd been fixed. To note: We made our arrangements on a reservation service, not through the hotel. Nevertheless they treated us like Hilton Honors customers (which we are; but not on this trip!)

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: taragl
Reviews.Content: I wish I could live at the Homewood Suites in Seattle. We stayed for several days and I wish we could have stayed longer. From the moment we arrived, the staff at the hotel were sincerely friendly and helpful. From the very top of the management team to the housekeeping staff, everyone had a smile and a moment to chat. Our room was wonderful for a longer stay. We had the ability to store food in the large refrigerator and cook for ourselves on the stove. You should note that if you wash your own dishes and leave them out to dry, housekeeping will load them into the dishwasher. When in doubt, they'll opt for sanitizing the dishes. The shuttle to area attractions was a fantastic service. We used it every day and saw so much of Seattle. The included weekday dinners were also quite nice. The food was hearty and plentiful, and there is wine available if you're a drinker. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mesutherland
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay easy access to the highway. Highway noise is there but hotel is well insulated so it's muffled. Staff is helpful. It's our place to stay in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BridgeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a bridge convention. Very nice, large, clean, well decorated suite. Two rooms (living room and bedroom) plus a fully appointed kitchenette. Cleaned every day. Breakfast AND dinner included (weekdays). 2 blocks from the convention center. Couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay; but watch cost of reservation changes”
Reviews.Author: SESomers
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Reports of highway noise in other reviews are exaggerated. I am sensitive to such things and it was simply not an issue. We walked practically everywhere from this great location. Don't let the proximity to interstate 5 throw you. Pedestrian traffic is beautifully accommodated, and protected, in Seattle and there is a walkway/sidewalk straight down Pike. Coming back will be mostly uphill so it is a little harder if you aren't in shape. The only problem we had was a need to leave, unexpectedly, a day early. Our room rate for our entire stay was impacted. Never had a Hilton brand do this to me before. :( Overall though good suite hotel. Clean. Can't beat location.

Reviews.Title: “If you get the right room location, its very nice”
Reviews.Author: thinkshift
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Nov. The first night we were on the top (9th) floor, street side. It was implied by the front desk that this higher up location was quiet - NOT! Neither my wide an I slept much at all that night. Must be why they have earplugs in the rooms, but I can't sleep with those either. For the 2nd & 3rd nights we moved to a room facing the inner courtyard, Wow! what a difference. Very quiet and relaxing. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was typical hotel complimentary buffet style. Ok, but mostly a means of sustenance. The cut fruit each day seemed kind of old. Fortunately they also put out bananas and apples. Location is good. We found it close enough for walking to a variety of attractions and restaurants (we like to walk). The farthest we went was the Pike street market for lunch one day which was probably a 30 minute walk. Parking is pricey, but typical of a downtown metro hotel. I would definitely stay here again but ONLY if I could be assured of an inner/courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites staff extremely nice and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Avery H
Reviews.Content: The staff here was tremendously helpful with parking assistance, dining recommendations, etc. Parking is expensive, but probably cheaper and hassle-free here.

Reviews.Title: “roomy accommodations near convention center”
Reviews.Author: LibbyGH
Reviews.Content: The first thing you need to know is that there are two Homewood Suites by Hilton in Seattle: "Convention Center/Pike Street" and "Downtown". This review is for the Convention Center location, which is situated on top of the partially covered I-5 freeway (not as bad as it sounds). I was on travel for work and stayed three nights. I was impressed by the size and layout of the 1-bedroom suite. It had a separate bedroom with dresser, a "living room" with pull-out couch bed, desk and dresser, and a kitchen with stove, dishes, cookware and dishwasher! I didn't do any cooking on this trip but if I were traveling with family this would have been perfect. Bathroom was large, with shower and tub. There wasn't any noise from inside the hotel but my room overlooked the city and there was some street noise. Breakfast was included and there was a moderate spread of cold and hot choices. I think coffee and tea were available 24/7. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from the Convention Center, about 7 blocks from Pike Place Market and even the space needle is walkable distance. Note: Seattle is hilly and you will be doing some walking as this hotel is on a hill!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: sjoconn
Reviews.Content: The room I had was very nice with a kitchenette and large bathroom. I liked the way the bathroom lighting would gradually get brighter (much easier on the eyes when first waking up). I would recommend making use of the valet parking as the hotel underground parking is narrow and difficult to negotiate. Rooms have cable TV with Showtime. Breakfast is included everyday and supper Tuesday through Thursday. All of downtown Seattle is a short downhill walk away (watch out for the uphill on the way back).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and price”
Reviews.Author: nickfoy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size with a kitchenette, living room, bedroom and bathroom. I enjoyed the extra space which is good when you are away from home for several days. The free breakfast is limited in choice but it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, wit friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: TAD_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Free breakfast and evening reception with dinner-like food and drinks. Staff is particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly place but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mrs_slink
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in most ways for our business trip to the nearby conference centre. Rooms were spacious with all amenities, the gym was clean and the staff were super friendly. The breakfast buffet was also pretty good and the hotel is within a straightforward walk of the centre of Seattle. Unfortunately, 2 things put me off - the corridors all had a musty smell, like the place was damp, and my 4th floor room facing Pike Street was SO NOISY! Honestly, it was like the window was open all night. If you book, ask for a room that does not face Pike Street and you will probably be fine :)

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: baddy11
Reviews.Content: When you walk into your room and see ear plugs by the bed side, that is never a good sign. The hotel itself is good, very friendly and courteous staff, but the room I was in was facing the freeway on the 8th floor and I do think the room had sound proof windows and patio door. End of the day, if I am not able to get a good night's sleep, I do not see much value in staying there. The poor rating is only because of the noisy room even though the amenities were very good / excellent. I am not planning to stay there again because a good night's sleep is more important to me than free wine in the evening...

Reviews.Title: “Side street quieter”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: We have 3 prior stays with this hotel, all on the street facing the freeway. I have not been bothered by the noise unless you open the door onto the balcony, the noise is very nicely muffled by the doors. The room 702 is on the side street. I like the bigger balcony and the room is quieter at night. There are nice sunset views over the city. Slight downside is the smaller bath. I previously reviewed this hotel and loved the really tall shower head, but the one in this room is standard height. The jetted tub is a nice touch but the control for the jets is outside the bathroom, above the light switches. I like the property and have been impressed with the staff and the helpfulness with directions and recommendations. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfy, clean, roomy suites!”
Reviews.Author: Davidsweetie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an excellent experience at our recent 2 day stay at the Homewood Suites in Seattle. Check-in was pleasant and efficient. Because it was my birthday, I was greeted with chocolates and cookies--a nice, unexpected touch. I requested a room on an upper floor facing the courtyard, based on other Tripadvisor reviews. Such a room was available and I highly recommend this since the hotel faces a busy Seattle street. Plus, the courtyard is a pleasant view. The bathroom was roomy--two sinks, toilet, and a jacuzzi tub in working condition. Good thick towels, too! The kitchen had a counter that sat 3 or 4, included a full sized refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and stove top. No oven, but we did not need an oven (we were on vacation---who wants to bake?) Dishes, tableware, pots and pans were included. The living room had a couch and flat screened television. The bedroom had two large closets and a very comfortable bed. A desk and chair was located between the living room and bedroom. Free wifi, too! The hotel is a well situated--just a short walk to the covention center, downtown shops, museums, and Pike Market. We picked up some great wine, cheese, and food and enjoyed it in our room. Also, the Capital Hill Area is another nice walk with interesting restaurants and shops. Eat at Sitka and Spruce if you like unusual mediterranean and north African flavors--absolutely delicious. We had a very good, reasonably priced Italian meal at La Spiga on 12th Avenue. We splurged on caviar at the Seattle Caviar Company where you can taste (generous samples) before you buy. There is no shortage of sights and things to do in Seattle but for something a little different, visit the Seattle Bug Safari, below Pike Place. It's a small bug "museum" that we enjoyed and kids will be enthralled! The hotel is relatively new, in excellent condition, and the rooms are roomy, very clean and quiet. Lots of families were staying at the hotel and I thought it might be noisy but it was not. The free breakfast was impressive--hot waffles, eggs, sausages, yogurt, cereals, coffee, tea, and juice. Better than many "free" breakfasts offered by other hotels. I understand that the hotel offers a free dinner during the week but we weren't there to try it. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Also, it's about a 5 block walk to the transit station where you can take a light rail to the airport--convenient and cheap, too! We plan on staying here next time we're in Seattle. I highly recommend the Homewood Suites in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldB
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and have stayed here 5 times since March. It is clean, great service, roomy, and it is so nice to be able to eat a full breakfast and dinner on site. Get an interior room as the street side can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mudbunny
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around noon after a long day of flying. To our great surprize our room was ready for us. We washed up and then walked to Pike's Market. When we arrived back the hotel to our pleasure dinner was served (including wine and beer) AS PART OF OUR STAY. The food was fresh, delicious and presented quite nicely. We found a table by the window so we could watch the goings on as we ate. Breakfast was equally good and they had a great choice every day. We were able to either walk or take a bus everywhere. Every one at the hotel was helpful, friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RosieNC
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent four nights at the Homewood Suites and enjoyed the experience. Although pricey, the inclusion of breakfast and dinner (during the week) somewhat offset the cost. The location was good - everything was within walking distance. Rooms were well appointed and clean; we requested a courtyard room after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor so things were pretty quiet. Employees were friendly and courteous and the bed was excellent. Only thing missing was a shower cap - the shower nozzles are very high so it's hard to use without getting your hair wet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room but right next to Interstate Highway”
Reviews.Author: JM_2793
Reviews.Content: The lobby and rooms are very nice. The location is outstanding being right on Pike St in downtown Seattle. The rooms may have noise from the Interstate, but they have ear plugs in the room if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: sar156
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our two night stay at the Homewood Suites. We had a suite on the top floor which was so much larger than we expected. It was like an apartment with full kitchen , living room and large bedroom.The decor was very pretty and modern, two large flat screen TVs, very comfy beds with lots of pillows, hardwood floors and a large bathroom. It was too bad we could not stay in the room more it was so comfortable but we were off sightseeing and found the hotel to be conveniently located to the downtown area. I think they used to have a free shuttle but it was discontinued. The hotel serves a free breakfast daily and also a light dinner with wine and beer from 5:00 to 7:00 on weekdays which was really nice .The room was pricey at $239 but we were able to use the Seattle Tour Saver coupon for a free night which made it a good value for us. The staff is very friendly and eager to help you in any way they can.l We were disappointed we were not able to get reservations for "Sky City" at the Space Needle but when we mentioned at the front desk it was done along with a special dessert sent to our table making the evening perfect. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it others!

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Love this Place, You Should be Slapped!”
Reviews.Author: b2theRad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here three nights so that we could explore Seattle before boarding our cruise to Alaska. Having never been to Seattle I was concerned about finding the right hotel. Sometimes staying staying in a downtown area can be hit or miss. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews at Tripadvisor and the lower price compared to other hotels in the area. I gotta tell ya, folks, Homewood Suites exceeded our expectations! Great location, groovy room, low price, helpful staff, yummy breakfast...dude, just book this thing already! You can walk to just about everything from here: Pike Place Market; the monorail to the Space Needle; nice stores (and Ross!); cool restaurants; the waterfront; and the art museum without having to walk through any janky neighborhoods. (safety is always a consideration to me) And hey, don't listen to these wussies who cry about it being too far or uphill walking back to the hotel. My wife and I are in our fifties and, after a full day of walking around town, we freakin leapt like gazelles back up to the hotel. It's uphill but not a big deal at all, certainly not worth mentioning unless someone is terribly out of shape (might be time to get a Rascal). The rooms are BIG and full of great stuff! (get it? "Big" is in caps to emphasize the big-ness) By great stuff , I mean free wi-fi, big flat screen, and a kitchenette that has everything but the....wait a minute...INCLUDING the kitchen sink! Okay, one reviewer complained that there was no conventional oven. Whaddaya gonna do? Cook a turkey in your hotel room? Sheeesh! The bed!!! Oh my, the bed was so comfortable I was down and out quicker than Old Yeller. I can't really comment on the noise factor as we actually enjoyed throwing open the windows and letting that cool Seattle air and the hum of the city lull us to sleep. That's how we roll. A free breakfast buffet,(delicious and nutritious) and a free dinner Monday through Thursday, including (you're gonna love this) free beer and wine. Ahhhhhh. Check this out. On the day we left to board our cruise, we didn't realize all the cabs in the city were booked, as several ships board and depart on the same day. The guy at the front desk says, "let me see what I can do." He makes some phone calls and gets us a stretch limo for the price of a cab! Five minutes later, it arrives and we're on our way. That was the cherry on top of a perfect stay at Homewood Suites. Now, get outa here and book that room!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend! Clean, nice, spacious, good food, close to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Reservation4Four
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference downtown and made the 3/4 mile walk to my hotel each day. I wasn't sure if it would be doable when I booked, but it worked out great. My colleagues who stayed at other hotels and heard or saw my room couldn't believe how nice my room was. Very clean, hardwood floors, marble counters, spacious, full kitchen, great complimentary breakfast buffet, dinners on most nights, friendly staff, Neutrogena toiletries. Extremely happy with my choice and would look forward to the opportunity to stay again. (I had a Studio Suite w. 1Q.) Note that this hotel is just a couple of blocks from the Convention Center, shopping, dining, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for Group of People”
Reviews.Author: ckmack
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends went down to Seattle for a convention and after our first choice of hotel was booked we decided to look at the Homewood Suites from a recommendation given to us from someone who had stayed there. The hotel has a decent location which is right next to the convention center, but can be a fairly long walk to the market or down to the pier. It may not seem like a great distance, but after a long day of sightseeing and walking, the walk back to the hotel can be tedious as it is located uphill. It is also set near a busy freeway, so anyone who is a light sleeper should request a room facing the courtyard. The hotel was luckily able to fulfil our request for one and we had no issues with any sort of noise from the outside. One of the nicest features is the size and layout of the room suites. The suite came complete with a fridge and freezer, 2 burner stovetop, dishwasher, sink, plenty of cupboard space and dishes. The bedroom was quite large and the living area the same which also came with a fold out bed which was surprisingly comfy. A huge bathroom made getting ready in the morning much easier for everyone as well. On top of the great rooms they also offer a great free breakfast every morning and even a free dinner Monday to Thursday. I have to say it was some of the best (free) food I have ever had but if you have the time and money you might want to stop somewhere else. We unfortunately did not have a lot of time in the mornings so the free breakfast was a lifesaver and is one of the best reasons to stay. Certainly not one of the luxurious locations I have stayed, but nothing to really complain about as it was very clean and the staff were extremely helpful with any questions we had. They also offer a small pool and hot tub which we didn't know about until we got there, so don't forget to pack your bathing suit if you want to go for a dip. I highly recommend the Homewood Suites for any group of people travelling, especially if you are doing anything at the convention center. That is of course as long as you don't mind the walk to some attractions and are looking for some extra value with the free meals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but kind of away from the action”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place in the beginning of our trip and then at the Hotel Andra at the end. Obviously, they are two different types of hotels. However, this place was pleasant and it was cool that it had a kitchen adn all the things we would need to feel at home. It was spacious, complete with a living area. the bedroom was kind of tight, but it had a king sized bed. I would prefer the br be small and the living area large. The breakfast area was nice. The only thing that I didn't like was that it was a lot further away from the touristy areas. It was a long walk, which is difficult with two young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, and location. Lots of street noise.”
Reviews.Author: Nymeria88
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us. It was two blocks from the convention center, where we were attending an convention. About 5 blocks to the mono rail to the space needle/city center and light rail to the airport, and 10 blocks from the waterfront. Everything was walking distance, it was wonderful. (The last bit of the walk is up hill, a bit annoying after a long day walking the city, but not too bad.) The breakfast every day was wonderful! Some form of eggs, meat, and potato, along with fruit and other standard hotel breakfast items. It is nice starting a full day of sightseeing with a good breakfast. We only made it to one of the evening meals, but it was very good as well. It had a salad bar, entree, vegetable, and cookies. Also, wine and beer. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room was clean and comfortable, but the living room was a bit cramped. Everything was clean and up to date. Nice furniture and carpet. The kitchen was nice, except there were only pots but no pans. And when it said full kitchen, I expected an oven. There was no oven. I checked three times to make sure the windows were closed because the street noise was so loud. We were on the ninth floor and it sounded right outside the window. Also, if the room is going to have a balcony, it should have chairs. A place to sit and enjoy it. Overall, great stay. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced for What You Get”
Reviews.Author: Red Raider Fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights last week. We wanted to be close to Seattle attractions so we opted to stay here. For three nights our bill was over $1,100. This hotel is not brand spanking new. It is showing some wear and tear--walls and furnishings are getting worn. One strange thing we noticed is that the cleaning staff did not empty the coffee pot or remove the filter or wash any dishes etc. For this price, I don't want to do anything but relax. I have stayed in nicer Homewood Suites that were a third of the cost. We moved to the Cedarbrook Lodge and found it to be a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say "AWESOME!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: Ray_Katie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to this hotel, it was immediately known that this location was prime. We pulled up into the parking garage where the valet team was incredible, and so this experience began. Check-in was a breeze and the team there was able to change our room to a higher floor to enhance the experience. Once I arrived at the room, it was like I arrived at a New York apartment. A full size kitchen, living room, bedroom, hall closet and separate bathroom made this room so spacious. My whole family felt like we were living it up the entire time. The pool was a little small, but wasn't used by many during our stay. The hot tub was relaxing and prepared us for the following day of walking around the area. Playing a game of pool was entertaining, but the room wasn't designed for a pool table. Oh well, minor detail. Pike's Market Place is less than a mile away. There are two major malls nearby as well and hello... the Space Needle can be in view with just a few steps. Breakfast was gourmet with with a variety delicious options including sausage and Belgian waffles. Fresh fruit and cereal were also available with coffee and juices for beverages. All in all, a great stay that I will never forget. This hotel is on top of their game!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome formula”
Reviews.Author: LivinTheDream48
Reviews.Content: Only hotel under $200 in Seattle. Complimentary full breakfast, with a dinner Mon thru Fri, make this the best hotel 'suites' value going. Plus, it is within walking distance to everything donwtown Seattle has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten by Bugs”
Reviews.Author: NicolitaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites Pike Street on a recent family vacation. When we arrived, we were informed by the front desk staff that the hotel was full and we were given an accessible room. while we accepted this room, we were not prepared to accept the bed bug bites which received. We have sought to have some satisfactory response from the hotel and to date we have been promised communication from the Manager at the hotel but up to the time of writing, we are still waiting for that call or email. Based on my experience noted above, I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring a fun city!”
Reviews.Author: lovehawaiiansunset
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center Pike Street was the home base for my daughter and I during our recent stay in Seattle. The one bedroom unit with king size bed and pull out couch in the living area provided us both with the needed space and privacy for our stay. The bathroom was spacious. The small kitchen bar was a nice feature as we ended our daily exploration by going to the Pike Street Market to pick up our dinner from the wonder array of local produce, fish, breads and wines that we carried back to our suite to prepare and enjoy. The facilities are well maintained and clean. Our windows overlooked the back courtyard that was quiet and green. The front desk staff was helpful and especially pleasant greeting me with a “Good Morning” when I arrived from my flight at 2:00 AM!

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to downtown with spacious clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed in a number of other hotels in the area, we were very surprised about not only the great location, but also the relatively large suites that allowed our kids to sleep outside in the living room while the parents had their own king bed in a room separated by a door. The suite also has a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, and microwave (no oven). Our corner king suite (for which sometimes you have to pay a little extra, but it was worth it with the kids) also afforded us a balcony view of the environs. They even have a small pool and a billiards table! Full, hot breakfast was great (albeit a little bit crowded); although we didn't get the chance to have even snacks (only Monday - Thursday evening), it appears that could be almost a full dinner, as well! The only drawback might be the reliance on valet parking, which was a bit slow and understaffed. Given that parking in the area is hard to find, you might just have to pay the $25 overnight fee. All things considered the proximity to everything, as well as the rooms was a great part of our recent trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: sterist
Reviews.Content: We were here for one night and the perfect location makes it very easy to go around the city. Room is very spacious with a nice view. The staff is also very helpful. Overall we find it a pleasant stay in this hotel. The only thing I would bring to your attention is the noise coming from the street. We stayed on the top floor and still heard the traffic. So it's better to ask for rooms on the top if you are a light sleeper. The hotel provides ear plugs on the bed side so that might be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with easy access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: byby-traveler
Reviews.Content: 2 stays at hotel in July. Check-in was a breeze with no wait. Front desk staff was very good everytime we had a question about the hotel/amenities, however, answers to questions about local transportation were vague. This hotel used to have a shuttle, but they have discontinued it. Hotel room was clean. Housekeeping was good and kept room clean. The pool was nice. The breakfast and 'dinner' was good, though busy as the hotel was packed both times we stayed. They restock the food pretty fast, though not fast enough for some of the impatient guests (that's another story). The only thing I have issue with is that my room key stopped working five times. They replaced the lock on the room door after the fourth time, but I had one more lockout after that. They said they had problems with key makers or card readers. As a side note, on the fourth time, I complained and was offered 5,000 HHonors points as a courtesy. I welcomed that offer, however, I have not seen the points credited to my account of this writing. No, I don't put the room card by my phone or wallet, thus it was not being wiped or interferred with by my hanlding of the card. Overall we really liked the hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a fine hotel, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: snowball0205
Reviews.Content: We only had the opportunity to stay one night, but the staff and accomodations were top notch. The morning hot breakfast was excellent. Our king bed room for two was not a suite, and a little overcrowded with big furniture. But beware of the contracted limo srevice, IT Limo, as we had nothing but misunderstandings, goof ups and trouble getting from the airport and later to the cruise pier.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Excellent Customer Service, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: chadrach3
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 2 daughters birthdays, by taking them to Seattle to visit the Picasso exhibit at the Seattle Art Museum. From the moment we checked into our hotel, our entire stay was wonderful. When the staff found out we were there to celebrate, they gave each of our children a bag of Milano cookies. They were so kind! Our room was huge and clean and beautiful. The design and decor were so lovely and upscale. We had a one bedroom suite and the kitchen/living area were the size of a studio apartment! (I believe we were staying in a wheelchair accesible room.) When it was time to head to SAM, Guest Services had a complimentary shuttle waiting to drop us off. The driver gave us his card and told us to call him when it was time to be picked up. Amazing!! Very rare find in the hotels we're used to staying at! We didn't spend much time at the hotel, regrettably. But the complimentary continental breakfast was deliciuos. The room was bustling, but didn't feel over-crowded. There was a great vibe to the place. The foot was good and hot and the coffee was perfect (of course, it IS Seattle!) We just wished we could've stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Pike Place”
Reviews.Author: Mickey60097
Reviews.Content: Homewoood Suites is just 10 blocks up hill from Pike Place, easy walk to lots of shopping. Our room/suite was great, separate bedroom, large bathroom, living room, kitchen, 2 flat screen TV's and outdoor patio. Pleasantly surprised by outdoor pool/hot tub and billards room. Hotel offers complimentary breakfast and amazing "welcome reception" from 5PM-7PM daily which includes dinner, beer and wine and cookies...it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Fool
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the Seattle Convention Center. The rooms were clean and nice. One of the better Homewood Suites I've stayed at. The room had a small balcony, but just opened out over an uninspiring road. Perhaps some of the upper rooms facing west or north have good views of the city, but my east facing room didn't. Of course, my east facing room didn't face the highway either. Being to the east of the Convention Center is a more residential feel, but a bit farther walk to the main downtown areas. Also, I found that the front desk folks seemed to know the local area (in many hotels the staff don't seem to have a clue about good food or things to do within a short walk). Bottom line: I would stay there again on a future visit to the city if I had to be near the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week during a vacation with extended family to Seattle. Was a mix of business folks, families and couples at the hotel, which is really conveniently located between downtown and the Capitol Hill neighbourhood (great for walking and eating!!!) Hotel is a bit on the older side, but everything was impeccably clean when we visited. The free breakfast buffets were very helpful to help us get our days started and had a good variety of food. We never got to try the evening happy hours from Mondays to Thursdays, when they offered a full meal plus drinks (including beer or wine) but others seemed to enjoy it. Outdoor pool is small but always welcome. There is a hot tub alongside, sun chairs and a billiards table inside. Parking is a touch steep (valet, $25+tax each day) but since this hotel is located downtown, it's not too surprising. Staffers were very friendly, always greeting us with a smile and a "welcome back!" we did have an issue with our water pressure (really weak). The front desk said they'd send someone to look at it and it got better, but not by very much. Also, the rooms are a bit noisy from cars, if that bothers you. Still, they were just small things for us since everything else was great overall. It was a real plus to have the kitchen facility. We didn't cook any meals (our relatives did though!) but the fridge, microwave, dishes and wine glasses definitely came in handy when we had to polish off leftovers!

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: StP81
Reviews.Content: I guess it is a business hotel when school is in session, but if you are there during summer months, be prepared for families, traveling youth sports teams, etc. If you want breakfast, go early, before the moms take 4 bananas, 3 yogurts and 5 boxes of cereal for their kids all-day snacking needs. (That's after the family has hit the breakfast buffet). The room itself was fine, though the mattress was really soft and not comfortable. The location is good, easily walkable to Pike Place market, monorail to get to Space Needle. We rented a car for 2 days to go to Mt Rainier and San Juan Island. Website says $18 a day parking, but that's on street (if you can find). Valet is $25, which is fine, but the website should be upfront. They could use more front desk help, there wasn't one time that we had a question or needed service that we didn't wait, even in non-peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: 808choosytraveler
Reviews.Content: This place is very nicely appointed in a large room with a large bathroom. The kitchen is nicely configured with most everything you'll need for a comfortable stay. The location is very convenient to public transportation, available on-street parking if you have a car, and close walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: BobGski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites hotel for four nights on the tail end of an Alaskan cruise. We actually had two different rooms (two nights apiece) with one being a suite and the other a regular room. If you stay for any duration, you are better off in the suite, which includes a kitchen, dining table and refrigerator. Both rooms had flat screen TVs but some one had pulled the cable out of the wall in the standard room. We reported the problem and left for sightseeing and returned to find no one had serviced the TV. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The included breakfast was very good, but if you stay at the hotel on a Friday night, because of cruises, the hotel is full to capacity and the breakfast area on Saturday morning is over-crowded. The location provided an easy down-hill walk to Pike's Market Place and there are many restaurants only a short walk away. Bus transportation is free from 7 am to 7 pm, and this will take you anywhere within the city limits that you like. Surprisingly, the hotel does not provide complimentary transportation to the airport. The price we paid was very reasonable considering the location but if you have a car, figure on spending another $20 per day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, would be back”
Reviews.Author: Kevcam12
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice hotel for 5 day of relaxing stay before our Alaskan cruise. I like Homewood for having a seperate bedroom. Our 2 kids in the living room with a TV and the wife and I in our room. Having breakfast included in cost is nice way to start our day. Strong free wifi signal is a plus. We enjoyed the pool and the jacuzzi is nice. Being 9 blocks from Pike St. Market and 2 blocks to Cheese Cake Factory is good. Best of all is the service. The staff works their butts off. Cons: Parking is $25. But is standard price for downtown Seattle. The bedroom is smaller then the ones in San Diego HWS's

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTravelers3
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed in this hotel when we came back from our cruise. We were very pleased with this hotel. The hotel is convienently located on Pike street which is a few blocks from the Pike Street Market. They walk was not bad and the metro station is near for those of you that can not walk. The room was large and clean. It was an apartment style room complete with living room, two televisions, sofa with pull out, full size refrigerator, dishwasher and dining area. The bed was extremely comfortable. The gym had updated equiptment with clean towels and water cooler. This hotel was quite a savings because of the Manager's cocktail party that comes with dinner. I believe the reception is offered Monday through Friday. We had potatoe crusted Cod fish with vegetables, salad, wine, beer and cookies. The food was very good and the service at this hotel was excellent. This is a wonderful family hotel with all the savings. The complimentary breakfast was also wonderful. Breakfast and dinner already taken care of by the hotel- You can't beat that! I will definitely be returning to this hotel when I am in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel like a King and Queen?”
Reviews.Author: rodeofans
Reviews.Content: Never saw a staff person in 3 days without a smile and a warm welcome. Spotless, large room with balcony--fresh air 24/7. Well stocked kitchen, clean furniture and linen. Easy on/off freeway. Never waited more than 5 mins for our SUV from the parking garage. No noise from our inside courtyard room. Great water pressure for showers--extra hot water!! Super fast elevators. Had guests on both sides of our room but never heard them. The king bed was a tad soft for us--but can't take our sleep number mattress on trips!! We will be making this hotel our place to stay in future trips to the big city!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pescador365
Reviews.Content: When one spends over $200/night for a room I certainly would expect a little more than we received. We checked in 3 days prior to our Alaskan cruise. When we went to hangup our garments we found the closet was less than 12 INCHES wide. To compound matters. it was already nearly full with an ironing board, extra blankets and a shelf for the iron. The bracket for the shelf obstructed the closet pole to the point my wife could only hang two of her dresses. I immediately requested a different roon but was told the hotel was sold out and there were no other rooms available. Our next surprise came when my wife tried to used the restroon and found the toilet seat was completely missing one of the bolts to hold it on. Surely the housekeeping staff would have noticed something like that when and if they cleaned the room. We again called the front desk to advise of the situation and they send maintenance up immediately to install a whole new seat. The rest of the facility was adequate and fairly centrally located to the downtown district but it certainly was not worth what we were charged.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of valet parking”
Reviews.Author: VIPGrant
Reviews.Content: I real enjoy downtown Seattle and Homewood Suites is in a great location. The room was great. It was basically an apartment with a full kitchen, living room, bedroom, and a large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. I could have easily rated this hotel with 5 stars if it wasn't for the valet serice (or lack of valet service). The parking was a nightmare. My wife and I didn't get to the hotel until about 11pm and when we arrived we were told that the valet was off for the evening so we had to park ourselves in a space that was only 50 feet from the lobby entrance. It was an open garage so I installed a security club on the steering wheel and we went back inside where they told us they still needed to check our keys into the valet office. When we came down the next morning, I gave the valet my ticket and let him know about the security club. He said it was no problem. We checked out of the hotel while they were getting our car and I asked for a discount for parking since I was unable to use the valet service when we arrived. They were persistent and said that if I didn't pay the $30 now (25 for overnight parking, 5 for parking fees/taxes) they would just charge our card. I paid it and as soon as we finished checking out, the valet returned on foot saying he could not get our car started. At this point, I was a bit irritated. So I grabbed the keys and hauled our stuff out to the car myself and we left. When I installed the club on the steering wheel, the wheel lock had engaged which also locks the ignition. To turn on the ignition, you have to turn the wheel slightly (pretty common feature on many vehicles). Apparently the valet couldn't figure that out. So, other than paying $30 for $25 overnight valet service with no valet, It was a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Like most Homewood Suites this one is at least excellent, but with issues”
Reviews.Author: hamptondragon
Reviews.Content: OK, I used to live in Seattle and when I rode the bus or drove on I-5 southbound through downtown I would notice this hotel and hoped to stay there someday if I ever were back for a meeting downtown. Well, someday arrived in June for a meeting at the nearby Sheraton. Hence, I chose this hotel as it was cheaper and I do like Homewood Suites. I was here 4 nights and like most any Homewood Suites there is a stove, fridge, ample dishes/silverware in the room, two room suites, free breakfast every day and a free dinner Mon-Thur. Not sure why the website doesn't specify a pool, but there is a nice pool open in the summer. The breakfast area always had waffle irons and fruit for the waffles, plus many other great choices. I did not notice any problems with keeping the breakfast area stocked as some recent reviews have commented on. I asked for a view of I-5 for old times sake and enjoyed the view (but Seattle sure is overgrown and this view shows that), but light sleepers or even medium sleepers beware. It is somewhat loud and the A/C/fan is also somewhat loud. However, I like background noise when I sleep and had no problems but again light sleepers beware. Even though the hotel does supply earplugs--I'd suggest asking for a courtside room that does not face I-5, of which the hotel has some if outdoor noise bothers you. There are some clear misses and this is one of my least favorite Homewood Suites (which I admit are as a group well above average and this hotel is above average). I reserved a an exact room on the 7th floor (you can do that online with some Homewood Suites) AND confirmed the location via phone 20 hours before arriving but they tried putting me in a different room and denied I had arranged a room. I knew the system well enough and had evidence to disprove them and did get a room near the top that faced I-5. They messed up on my room rate even with me confirming twice what the price would be and then messed things up on how they reported in on my credit card--which affected bonus points (but I also corrected that problem later on). Like most Homewood Suites, being a Gold or Diamond Hhonors member means little here, but it may have helped in room selection a little. Overall, nice perks of the Homewood Suites, but it is loud, not in the greatest part of town (but safety is a minor issue in my mind), but the staff has problems with matching online reservations and prices to reality. That is not acceptable and Homewood Suites needs to be above this.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, underwhelming stay”
Reviews.Author: TKS1227
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle for the first time and wanted to stay in the city without a car. This was a great location to do so, 10 blocks up from Pike Street Market. The suite (for a family of 4) was roomy and clean, but without a table and chairs for all of us to sit if we wanted a meal together (even with the great kitchen), just a counter with 2 bar stools. Breakfast: on each of our four days, the staff seemed overwhelmed and unable to keep up with the crowd, which was not so huge. There was always something missing with a lot of waiting around for substitutions and having to ask to get things (more bagels please, more yogurt please, more OJ, more forks, etc.). It felt like they hadn't served breakfast before and didn't know what to expect! Note: contrary to the hotel's web site, there IS a pool in the summer. Wished we had bathing suits! HHonors members: no extras offered even for a Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LeoandMagda
Reviews.Content: We had a stay off 3 nights in this hotel. The room was great, clean and there was also a kitchen. The breakfast was a buffet with everything you wish. All the staff was very helpfull. For me this was a 9.9. We are a couple off Belgium and if we visit Seattle again we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and great staff”
Reviews.Author: UsaLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the hotel team at the Seattle Homewood Suites. I stayed for 5 nights and had a great stay. the meals were very large (and for free) I love that where i didnt have to spend anymore money going to breakfast or dinner so i saved a ton of money!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay - excellent with family!”
Reviews.Author: Mommydiva_Chelle
Reviews.Content: We find that we continue to return to this location as our stay is excellent each time we have been here. We frequent Seattle for Mariners games with our children (now 18 and 7) as well as other family members (late 70 and late 80 in age respectively). We all find the breakfast more than adequate and look forward to them. Our rooms are always clean and nicely appointed. Any requests we have had have been promptly addressed. I cannot think of one time that we have experienced anything less than satisfactory, including the friendly, accommodating staff. My greatest sadness is that we are bringing the family ( my 80 yr old MIL included) this weekend for Mariners games and were unable to secure a room. What I could find remaining with you that might hold us all was more expensive than usual, leading me to think you have a convention in the area as well as the pending holiday. We will miss staying with you - this will be a new experience for us! I hope they come close to making us as comfortable as you always do. We will be back for sure!!!! You are our favorite place to stay in Seattle with our family. The pool was being remodeled most of the time we thought to bring suits so we haven't tried it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: peakprfrmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights before our Carnival cruise. We had about 6 rooms total. The staff and hotel accommodations were outstanding. Food in the evening and the breakfast were great and had nice selections. We too were told of the shuttle on the site, and informed that it was cancelled, but we walked to pike street market and various parts of downtown Seattle with ease. The pool was not open for summer yet, but they did have a little room with a pool table, board games and a tv where we all congregated a time or two. Clearly this place was newly remodeled and should not be missed. Ate at Tango across the street. Well worth it. (Check out other review).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: conniej238
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this great Homewood Suites for five nights while attending a conference at the Seattle Convention Center. It was easy to get a shuttle from the airport and the convention center was an easy 2 1/2 block walk from the hotel. On rainy days, I was able to stop at the fromt desk and borrow an unbrella. I enjoyed the morning breafasts and evening meals. One morning they had the best blueberry scones! The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and I love the decor. I was able to walk down to Pike Place Market. It was great! This is the place to stay when attending a convention in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No...never again”
Reviews.Author: crapsshooter
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a cruise to Alaska! Yeah! Started the trip off 3 days early in Seattle staying in the Homewood Suites on Pike Street. Not so great, 1st I didn't get the room I reserved. I travel with two middle sized kids and reserved a double suite, two queens. I got to the room and there was only one queen and it was accessible so no bathtub. I immediately called to get a different room as we need two beds, and I prefer a tub. I was told that there was a U2 concert and there were no rooms available to me so they sent up a roll-away. I was going to make the most of it and went on about my vacation. The next morning my daughter told me the bed was very uncomfortable with ha huge spring right in the middle of her back. I asked again to be moved, they had a king suite so I took it. Room 438, make note and NEVER take this room. It is literally street level with all the noise of trucks, cars, emergency vehicles, and tourist running up and down the street. There is a door to a patio that had a paddle-lock on it. Don't feel so safe here after all. So Sunday came along and we checked out and went to the port to board our cruise. Within 5 minutes of arriving and 30 minutes of leaving the hotel my daughter realized she left her wallet in the nightstand drawer. I called and was put through to a voicemail, I left a detailed message with all my contact info. Never got a call, never had anything acknowledged, nothing. When we arrived back in Seattle, after checking into a different hotel I called and they didn't know anything I was talking about, looked in the lost and found (can you believe it wasn't there?), and put me through to another voice mail. All I am getting is the run around and :"that's how we handle things left behind" speech. I think that a wallet deserves different treatment and yes, we left it behind, but called and reported it right away. Just finally got the manager of the hotel and feel no better about my stay or the hotel. I am off that brand altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place although they pulled the rug out from under us”
Reviews.Author: Sherri9360
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites on Pike Street was booked by myself and about 10 other people. The reason I chose this location was the free transportation offered by the hotel within a one mile radius. We were all very excited that the shuttle would drop us off to tour Seattle withing a one mile radius of the hotel. Upon arranging transportation one day to visit a few tourist spots, the notified me that the shuttle was abruptly canceled forever. The front desk told me the manager canceled if indefinitely with any reason. I shared with her that that is the main reason we booked the hotel. By doing this we had to PAY for transportation for a ghost tour that evening. The hotel did not seem to care....... I was embarrassed as I pursued the group to book this hotel for that reason alone and was made to look like a fool. The hotel itself is very nice, the rooms are very small but clean. The breakfast and dinner provided are good. We had business to conduct the first day for a few hours and then we were looking forward to sightseeing in the rain with our free shuttle service............that did not happen. If they ever inform you of a shuttle service, don't trust them.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you don't want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and updated. There was plenty of space for me, my wife and 2 daughters. The problem is that it is right off of a very busy road and it was nearly impossible to sleep. Also the breakfast buffet was horribly inefficient even with three breakfast attendants. Most Homewoood suites I've stayed at only have one and do a much better job. Trash was overflowing, they were constantly out of hot items, and finding a clean table was impossible. These are all the things that kept me from giving the hotel a higher rating. As I mentioned before the room itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: sudhir_virendra
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Comfortable and friendly. Staff was helpful. The service was good. The parking was not free but it was reasonably priced. Did not use the spa or the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Renovated Older Building”
Reviews.Author: mdhinder
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels and I must say this is one I wish I had been staying for an extended length of time. The room was spacious, had lots of closet space and the bath was huge. I loved the balcony off the living room and the kitchen was very modern & functional. There was a party in the rooms near me, but I didn't hear them once I went to the bedroom. The hotel supplied ear plugs on the nightstand which midway thru the night I probably should have used due to the heavy emergency vehicle traffic. The employees were very friendly. I walked down to the waterfront and market area and utilized their shuttle service to return later that evening. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Feedback from Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJWTweedHeadsNSW
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about staying at this hotel with all the great reviews & facilities but found our internet booking didnt go through. They havent even bothered to acknowledge my emails.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: RobinYS
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed here 3 nights. We used the shuttle extensively (another hotel even told us NO Seattle hotel has shuttles) and the two shuttle drivers were helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to help us. Don't know if it's because we tipped every time, but I have a feeling they're just good guys. The food was wonderful - not haute cuisine but for a family on a budget with three little children and a grandmother, it worked out well for us. Gave us a portable crib when we asked. Took care of our luggage. Beds and sheets and pillows were very comfortable. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable but I've never slept on a comfortable one before. The windows did seem like they were open because they didn't seem to seal well but we did not hear outside noise, just a sort of hum from life outside which actually helps our children sleep better. A couple nights we heard sirens for a few seconds. One morning we got an apology for the fire alarm going off the night before but we were never disturbed any of our nights (and my husband is a pretty light sleeper) and certainly never heard a fire alarm. Even higher end hotels like the Hyatt have kept us up with noise from the hallway and other guests but we never heard a thing. Coffee is wonderful. Wifi worked well and no other place we stayed at during our trip in Seattle, Vancouver or Alaska had free wifi and the wifi you paid for was much worse than Homewood's speed. So many of their amenities are free as well, that it took a little adjustment with our other two hotels on our trip. Probably the best endorsement came from my children who kept asking us to go back to the Homewood, even after staying at a higher end hotel in Vancouver (snobby, not so helpful, more crowded) and a cruise ship! This is the place we'll stay at if we ever are in Seattle again, and we've recommended it to my sister to recommend to her friends as she lives in a suburb of Seattle. I like businesses that aren't afraid to ask people to give feedback on public sites and their own surveys because they are truly out to be a good hotel. None of the other hotels we stayed at cared about what we thought. This hotel did while we were there and when we came back. This is only the second review I've done on tripadvisor - the last place was in Belgium in 2004 and I can't even remember my login anymore - because a place has to be truly good to deserve my time to post!

Reviews.Title: “Like home!”
Reviews.Author: Jenephuer
Reviews.Content: Homewood is always the best for extended stays. This location has great service and a wonderful location. Excellent weekday receptions. Salmon and cocktails are on the menus. Decent daily breakfast and clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle choice!”
Reviews.Author: af3
Reviews.Content: Had read many reviews here and elsewhere and felt confident that Homewood Suites on Pike would work well for my travel buddy and me for our Seattle stay. My friend kept thanking me over and over for finding the perfect place. We arrived from Victoria via seaplane and it was a short cab ride to the hotel. We arrived midmorning and were pleased to have our suite available. Nice views from the 9th floor (have to change elevators at the 8th floor and find the elevator to the 9th down the hall a bit). We were impressed with the room layout: one bedroom with a king, white duvet, wall-mounted tv, separate bathroom with the best showerhead ever, living room with a sofabed for me (pretty comfy), large flat-screened tv mounted over the fireplace, desk with ergonomic chair, kitchen with dishes, as well as coffee, tea, popcorn. The closet in the living room is huge. There was a balcony as well... though the weather didn't make it that inviting while we were visiting. Loved the 5-7 pm reception with wine, beer, and much more food than I've ever experienced at such a venue. There were even fresh baked cookies besides the meatball sandwiches and salad bar one night. Morning breakfast is varied, with fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, hot food selections (one morning it was scrambled eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, make your own waffles with fresh strawberries and whipped cream, as well as the usual juices and coffee. Several employees are constantly refilling and cleaning, all very gracious and helpful. Brandon, the food service manager was working as hard as everyone, making sure guests were satisfied. Kudos to the front desk, too. Scotty the driver dropped me off at Westlake Center where I caught the light rail to SEA-TAC for my flight home. Unfortunately,my friend needed a lift to the Amtrak station, but she needed to get there before the shuttle service started. Still, we felt we hit the jackpot when booking Homewood Suites on Pike. Thanks to sales manager Lana Bulanova who helped link my paid stay to my Hilton Honors award stay. She is a gem and such an asset to the company.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Scott Johnson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great trip to Seattle and the Homewood Suites on Pike. We have stayed at this property a number of times over the last several years and we continue to be very pleased with this property. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite with King bed and sofa bed. There is a small kitchen with fridge, stove top and dishwasher. Very clean and well appointed with lots of room for family of 4. Our trip was mostly to attend a conference at the Convention Center (Sakura Con 2011) and you couldn't get any closer or more convenient. 2 minutes door to door. While in Seattle we spent time at Pike Place Market just down the street and went to a Mariners game as well.
