All the staff at this hotel are very service oriented with special mention to Pete, Danielle, Scott and Kelvin. All very friendly, professional and interested. It really is a pleasure to have the hotel staff care about your stay and handle any questions or concerns with such professionalism. In addition to the rooms and great staff, we really appreciate the morning breakfast and complimentary shuttle. Breakfast has a wide selection of hot and cold items and although busy the food was consistently refilled throughout the morning. The shuttle took us to the Mariners game and back as well as to a couple of local restaurants. Very easy to book and use. Our entire family is pleased with this property and we hope to stay here on every trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A great set up, much better than the standard conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Homesick_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood Suites while at a recent conference at the convention centre. I found the set up really convenient and really liked not constantly having to eat out. The suites all have some cooking facilities and a breakfast buffet is provided included in the price. On weekday evenings there is also a light evening meal including wine or beer provided free of charge. The food is not cordon bleu but the breakfast had enough variety to make most people happy. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and rooms were of a good standard. The only downside was freeway noise - ear plugs are provided though! Although Homewood is part of the Hilton group the experience was very different from the standard Hilton city-centre hotel experience, service was better and I didn't feel like they were going to try and charge me extra every time I moved a muscle.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Familypraystogether
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean,staffs were friendly,food served at the buffet on breakfast/dinner was good,shuttle drivers were very nice...what else I can asked for! I give this hotel a rating from 1-5 to score of five because of the excellence they give to customers like us from out of town. I've talked to other customers,they've been coming back and forth to this place coz of all amenities that you cannot find to other hotels around Seattle. Overall, my family & I enjoyed everything and hope to come back to Seattle and stay here again,maybe no changes withe the good service they give to all!....one thing,shuttle was busy because they only have one so the waiting time is a little bit longer!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dmills1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 7th to the 10th while attending a conference at a nearby hotel. We stay here because of: FREE Breakfast, FREE Internet and FREE welcome reception (Weekdays only) and cheaper parking than the host hotel. Plus it's a suite, and not just a hotel room.. The only negative to our stay was the manager's reception on Thursday. It's from 5 pm to 7 pm and I arrived about 6 pm to find the place just packed. The room menu indicated Fried Chicken, Mashed Potatoes, Mixed Vegetables, salad, etc..... except they had ran out of Fried Chicken... and I wasn't particularly just interested in potatoes, veggies and a salad, so I left and went and ate elsewhere. The rooms that face the freeway can be noisy, but they do provide earplugs. The bedroom seems quieter than the living room and I'm not sure if that's due to different windows or what.

Reviews.Title: “Superb on all levels (including parking)”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay (April 5-8). On previous visits I stayed at the Springhill Suites and Residence Inn, but this is my place from now on. As a road warrior (30 weeks on the road a year), I appreciated all this hotel had to offer. However, my first comment has to be on the post immediately prior to mine (one star), as to the $30 a day parking and no where to park. I, too, hate to pay hotel prices for parking. However, directly across the street as well as the surrounding streets is FREE parking from 6 p.m. to 8 a.m. and other times are $2.00 an hour. We paid a total of $9.00 for three days parking at this hotel. As previously mentioned the breakfast and dinner options are top notch and plentiful. Wine and beer is included at night. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are top notch. We were on the 9th floor which is the Hilton Executive floor. The rooms included kitchen, fireplace and balcony. The hotel is near the freeway, but my room faced an inside courtyard and was very quiet. As a gym rat, I seldom find hotel gyms satisfactory. This gym had the standard precors, treadmills, one bike and some free weights. However, there is an excellent 24 Hour Fitness (Sport) approximately five minutes away by foot (1827 Yale) with all the machines and equipment anyone could want. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: jtraveler23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The room was clean and the view was amazing. The main problem that I had during my stay was upon checkout when I realized I was being charged $25 a day to park my car in the hotel parking garage. Other than this everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is outrageously expensive”
Reviews.Author: ashishkverma
Reviews.Content: When you pull into this hotel, parking is $30 whether you get valet or self-park. There are not many options if any around the hotel ( I tried looking) and so they have exploited this and made it really expensive. Apart from that, it is the typical homewood suites and so it does have a nice look, is clean and has a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LadyJanePottle
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay for the Convention Center. The suites are roomy, the food is good--especially the hot breakfast-- and you're near everything. The shuttle is a big plus. I enjoyed coming back to a snack and a glass of wine in the evening, and loved having a place to do my laundry. I was very comfortable, and did not want to leave! I even bought a Lewis the Duck to take back with me. I hope I can get back to Seattle again soon, and I'll definitely stay here. I loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ashley1864
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience staying at Homewood Suites. I met one of your managers, Lana, at the evening reception and she was a true delight. She was very kind and courteous to our family and really went out of her way to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. I will absolutely reccomend this Hotel to my Family and Friends, and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: InKleined2Blue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to everything -- convention center, restaurants, shopping, Seattle Art Museum, monorail, light rail, and Pike Street Market. We walked or took the light rail or monorail everywhere. The breakfast each morning was hearty and varied. Dinner was nothing to brag about, but it was more than adequate. Word to the wise, unless you are on a tight budget or just don't want to go out, you'd be foolish to stay in for dinner with so many fine dining options nearby. The room was terrific; more like a small apartment with a full kitchen, bedroom, living area, bath, and a nice little balcony. Everything was clean and tidy. The folks who work at this hotel are exceptionally nice and very helpful. We had only one bad experience (minor though it was) and that was with an Asian lady who worked in the dining area. When we asked for salsa, she was abrupt and refused to provide the condiment although we had seen an ample bowl full just moments before. We never figured out why it was taken away and why we couldn't have any. Tis a mystery! The biggest downside to the hotel is street noise and panhandlers. I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers. The rate is reasonable for the quality of service and accomdations. I would stay again and intend to look into other Homewood Suites when I travel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vbmegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a two night stop on our way to Hawai'i in January. This hotel was very trendy and clean. We arrived late on a Friday night and departed on Sunday. Our goal was to tour the city for the day and we walked everywhere from the hotel. Pike Place Market is about 7 or 8 blocks from the hotel and the convention center is 1 block away. Check out the crepe stand underneath the convention center overhang right by the hotel - the bananas foster crepe was to die for. We ate at a pizza place highly recommended by friends (and afterwards on the Food Network) called Serious Pie. If you're a pizza lover, check that out. Otherwise, just plan on eating as much seafood as possible at Pike Place, along with Beecher's Flagship mac and cheese right by the market. We fell in love with this city and the hotel was a great place to come back in the evenings and relax. The free breakfast and full kitchenette where we could store our leftovers definitely didn't hurt.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff wanting to be sure you are enjoying your stay.”
Reviews.Author: tonichestnutantosha
Reviews.Content: Great staff, lovely modern lobby and breakfast room. Clean, good size room with granite counter tops in kitchen and bathroom. Great location if you are going to see a show at the Paramount Theater. Great breakfast. The buffet area is kept clean and well stocked. Close to everything, only 8 blocks from Pikes Market. If I had to find something that wasn't perfect it would be some noise coming from the highway. It didn't bother me, I feel asleep quickly and I slept well in the very comfortable bed but my daughter was bothered by some traffic noise. I would go back for sure and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice hotel, and a walk to The Paramount. I recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CheersToTraveling
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience staying at Homewood Suites. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They answered all of my questions with a good attitude, which I really appreciated. They were a great first impression. The parking/baggage attendants were very accommodating to us upon check-out, and let us leave our cars and check our bags for a few extra hours at no extra charge. A big THANK YOU! That said, we had a strange encounter with the valet parking attendant when we first arrived at the hotel. I pulled in to the garage and started driving up the ramp. The attendant stopped me on my way up the garage and made me drive back to the bottom, where he then told me he would park my car. I said I was fine to park my own car, but he insisted, assuring me that it was the same price regardless ($29.88 with tax). It felt like he was pushing me to do valet parking so that I might tip him later. I felt awkward and uncomfortable, so I just let him park my car. There was an incident during our continental breakfast in which the manager had to come out and speak with a man who was out of line, eating the breakfast although he was not a guest in the hotel. He verbally attacked the manager, but I thought the manager handled the situation perfectly. It impressed me that the issue was being handled so promptly and with such grace. The hotel and rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The continental breakfast was fabulous (loved the fresh blueberries!). The location was PERFECT, as we were attending a concert at The Paramount. You can't get much closer than we were! My only complaint about the physical hotel is that there was no ice machine on our floor. And, while we were not "extended stay" guests, I can see that this would be a great hotel for that. It also worked well for us, staying only one night! Overall, I had a great experience. I'd recommend it to anyone. Oh, and don't miss the restaurant Dragonfish. It's only a few blocks away. Tasty Asian cuisine with a killer happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “A review from your extended stay business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: As a person that lives out of Homewood suites hotels from coast to coast year round I can compare them well. This is one of the best I've stayed at. 1. The best catored Homewood suites ever! The food quality varies considerably often towards the lower end at Homewood suites everywhere. Well you can forget about the nacho night with dry chips in a basket and a cheese dispenser, this hotel had some of the best food choices for the evening meals I have ever seen! Sure it's not filet mignon but how about stuffed Salmon? YEAH! Great evening eats, very friendly and helpful "hosts". Nicely done! 2. Rooms: Sure most Homewoods are a two room type layout. But the size, appointments and layout make you feel like you are living in a small apartment at this hotel. Very nice! 3. Location. So many walkable options for dining and more park the car and hoof it! Top notch Homewood. Keep those evening meals up guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Friendly staff, May considering avoiding the holidays”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting Seattle on New year's eve, The hotel itself is excellent. The suites are clean , spacious and comfortable. We had a room next to the street which did have a little street noise but earplugs are provided if you need them. There is a Breakfast and light Dinner( Monday - Thursday) included with the room which was a pleasant change. It's well located only a 10-15 minute walk to pike place and most of downtown Seattle. There were only 2 drawbacks that i experienced firstly there was no hot water available at 7:30 in the evening, i didn't report this but i assume it was due to the number of guests on a busy evening. Secondly there appeared to be some type of party going on in some of the rooms before we went out and when we arrived back at the hotel there were a lot of young people hanging about in reception who didn't appear to be staying in the hotel itself and there had been some disturbance with the fire alarm. Overall, i enjoyed by stay in the hotel and if it suits your budget a worthy option.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located almost next to the Convention center and about 5 mins walk down to the main shopping district and 7-10 mins walk to Pike Place Market. Rooms inculded a free breakfast which was better than a standard Hampton Inn affair (and real plates and knives!) , a "Managers drinks" in the evening with free drinks and some food and 2 computers in the breakfast area (free wi-fi throughout). The first room I was given overlooked a very busy road and was so noisy that I thought the window had been left open, I was immediately moved to a suite on the executive food which was much bigger and overlooked a courtyard. Unfortunately though it was freezing cold (despite 3 or 4 complaints and after having supposedly been attended by an engineer) so I hardly slept one night. The Executive floor was the 9th floor and to reach it you need to take the elevator to the 8th floor and then walk half way along the corridor to get in another elevator from the 8th to 9th floors - might be annoying if you need to keep going back to your room/ have a lot of luggage or small children/ strollers. All in, I'd stay here again but only in a room overlooking the courtyard as there is no way I could sleep with the noise from the road.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk.”
Reviews.Author: aviationpassion
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel Just Unacceptable Customer Service. ・Lacked Toothbrush/toothpaste. Went to front desk and was asked to purchase one at the suite store. ・Lacked slippers. ・Some poor staff. ・Room bath had poor draining. ・Received no notice about a broken furnace for hot water. ・We were told by the front desk staff shortly after checking-in that they would refrigerate food behind the front desk in order to compensate for the lack of refrigerators in the guest rooms. So we did. The next day, we went down to the lobby to collect our food hoping we would have a small bite for Christmas since many restaurants would be closed. Turns out the food was misplaced. Quite agitating and irresponsible considering we had received a tag that guaranteed the return. The staff insisted that they would cover a meal given that we would bring back a receipt. After we found out the restaurant where we got our take-out that disappeared was closed, we called the front desk and asked if they would be flexible for other options. They reaffirmed it with us and so the next day we decided to have the hotel cover a meal that costs more than what the take-out was worth. We felt that it was about how much the hotel should pay considering the lack of service we experienced. When we arrived back at the hotel and approached the front desk staff, Danielle, to give our receipt she said she had heard nothing about this and called a staff member who we had previously confronted. Soon after hanging up, she rejected the receipt saying the hotel is unable to cover such a cost. We got a very cold attitude from her and it ruined the night, the night of Boxing day. Any how, a part from the lack of quality service, the stay actually was not too bad(that is after we talked to the manager). The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and location in the city was good. Note: Walls are not sound-proof.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back”
Reviews.Author: Minnisnowda
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets it. The minor details are what set this hotel apart from the others. Ashley at the front desk was extremely sweet and accommodating, checking me in well before the 3pm check in time after a horribly delayed red eye flight from the right coast. The rooms are immaculate. Clean, nice furniture, and are fully stocked. Small things like the basket full of umbrellas at the entryway really set this hotel apart. Yes, we all know it rains in Seattle, but how many of us pack umbrellas on our trips? Probably not many. Hotel is definitely in walking distance to the Space Needle/Pike Market and Westlake.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space to spread out--right downtown.”
Reviews.Author: geefour907
Reviews.Content: This all-suite hotel is great for taking care of business in downtown Seattle. It's just upstream from the Wash. state convention center on Pike Street--straddling two neighborhoods: downtown and Capitol Hill. Much of my day is spent on the phone--heading out to various appointments throughout the day. So I spread out on the desk when I arrive. The hotel offers free breakfast (scrambled eggs, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc.) and a "light" dinner with wine/beer. Pretty good, really. But often, I just wander down to nearby Whole Foods and pick up some goodies to throw together in the room. They've got a microwave/fridge and all the silverware/goodies you need. On the Capitol Hill side, there is a great Spanish Restaurant "Tango" that's right across the street. And about 10 blocks away is a hot yoga studio, "Sweatbox" that I frequent. I'm grateful Homewood Suites has a guest laundry for my sweaty workout clothes. The lobby is spacious enough to meet someone on-site, but I requested (and rec'd at no additional charge) access to a private conference room. Very nice. They've also got a small workout area (I've never used it) and a billiards room (been there twice). Like other Homewood Suites, this property has a round-the-clock sundry shop--which includes microwavable dishes, ice cream (b-a-a-d Ben + Jerry's!!) and lots of other stuff. The parking, like anywhere in downtown Seattle, is outrageous ($27/day). I belong to Hilton's "HHonors" program--so the staff is very nice to me (they're nice anyway!). I used to stay here when it was "Pike Street Suites"--but the new renovation to Homewood Suites really took it up a notch. I've become friends with some of the staff--who weathered the renovation and are quite proud of the results. Rightfully so, IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrdice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood suites over thanksgiving for two nights. It is in a good location to the downtown area. It is a bit noisy due to the highway nearby, but I had no problem tuning it out. Our room was very nice. It had a kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. Plenty of space. There was a breakfast in the morning. It consisted of coffee, juice, yogurt, cereal, yogurt, toast, and eggs. The rooms had flat screen tvs. Would stay here again as the price is very reasonable and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpfu staff, great lite meals and convenient”
Reviews.Author: love-those-beaches
Reviews.Content: Parking was alittle inconvenient but acceptable. Stayed there 2 nights. Loved their free shuttles to attractions although it is all walkable (surprisingly). Their shuttle personnel was VERY helpful. Front staff spoke several lanugages and friendly, even helped locate a cell charger for me on loan when we forgot to bring one. Meals were good but need to get there early otw they run out. Coffee is excellent any time of day! Ask & received a rollaway bed for our teen, a tad cramped but do-able. Also did not take advantage of their free washer/dryer. No pool. only 2 computers by breakfast area, not enough to accomodate many guests. Umbrellas on loan! Beautiful city, thank u HS for helping us with a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: ailsafross
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on November 20th, with a friend. I was visiting from Scotland and we wanted to have a night downtown. I work as a Front Office Manager in the hotel industry and have previously worked for a Hilton property so I have high standards when staying in hotels. But I am pleased to say that my expectations were not only met, but exceeded! The young lady who greeted us at check in was so friendly and helpful and both me and my friend were delighted to hear we had been upgraded to a suite. Our room was clean, beautiful and spacious. I was even more impressed when we received a call from the front desk to check we were pleased with our room. And then upon our departure to do some sightseeing, the front desk agent greeted us by name. This is something I love and expect my team to do so it is wonderful to see it in practice in other hotels. Our service the following morning was again excellent. The young lady on the desk, who's name I did not get but who is moving to England soon, was a credit to the hotel. She was friendly and helpful and answered all of our questions perfectly. She even allowed us to park for an extra 2 hours after check out for free. Overall, I was so pleased with the outstanding customer service we received. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here? WOW!”
Reviews.Author: WAMarathoner
Reviews.Content: We bid for this room and thought that even if it was a dump, it would suffice for a single night. We were pleasantly surprised! When I first checked in, the front desk clerk (Ashleigh) was sunshine and professionalism. I asked for two beds, which weren't available (it's becoming a pattern with "bid" rooms). I let her know that we were there for the marathon and one of us *cough* snores. She said they weren't completely full, and that she could upgrade me to a suite with a pull-out couch. Worth whatever upcharge there was going to be. None? Did I hear that right? She said that since they weren't full, she wanted to make sure I enjoyed my stay. I got to the room and it was huge. Small living room, decent sized kitchen, large bathroom, and.... wait for it... a separate full bedroom that felt about the same as the Seattle Renaissance. It was decorated in a tastefully minimalist style, with upscale bedding, flat screens (yes, 2), granite counters, and plush carpeting. We had a view of the water from our window, and it was a gorgeous sunset. Breakfast the next morning was a typical breakfast bar, but hooray for some protein! (scrambled eggs). They have weeknight manager's receptions M-Th. The business center is a single computer and printer, but it's in a nice, secluded room complete with a small library of books. Free Internet throughout the hotel that was pretty quick to load. There's a small store in the lobby with reasonably priced snacks (that, too, was a shock - the reasonable part.) Parking in Seattle SUCKS. There's no way around it -- except that the one block around the hotel has 24 hour free parking. We were lucky enough to find a spot. It was 5 blocks up and 6 blocks over to the start of the Seattle Marathon (the stadium at Seattle Center). Enough of us were there that a shuttle would have been good thinking. I'm really impressed with this hotel. The service was amazing, and every employee we passed acknowledged and/or greeted us. The hotel was spotless and looks new inside. Even at full price, this would be a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “REDEMPTION”
Reviews.Author: JKPierson
Reviews.Content: I must say the room was large and comfortable, the imentities were great and the best complimentary breakfast we have ever had. However, Initially my stay was not pleasent due to very noisy windows that were off the track allowing street noise all night to keep us awake. They had no one on duty late to fix them. However, after speaking with Megan the reservation manager, she refunded the cost of our stay to make up for the horible night. This shows the hotel cares about their guest and as business owners who care about our customer's, we would have done the same. "GREAT JOB" on customer service. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Tall showers”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a 6 foot 4 inch spouse develops an appreciation for really tall shower heads. Most hit him in the mid chest but this one was wonderful. way up high, good pressure, consistent temperatures. The entire hotel is delightful. Walking distance to the convention center, only 2 blocks. Close from the West lake train stop from the hotel. The downtown shuttle was a life saver with heavy rains and wind on this trip. The drivers are professional, polite and know their city. The front desk was responsive to our only repair need. The television in the bed room only had sound, no picture. They had a repairman up in less than 5 minutes who was able to trouble shoot and repair it in less than 2 minutes. My husband rated the breakfast waffles great. The variety of food at the breakfast buffet was good. They had flavored creamers for the coffee, a nice touch. The rooms are huge with plenty of room to relax. The room 618 was only noisy when we went out on the balcony to watch the traffic and weather. Sleeping was fine with both the comfort of the bed and the noise from outside. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hltaplayer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel, the staff was hands down very professional, friendly and gave exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: nlw2
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Homewood Suites on Pike was very enjoyable. I was there for six nights. While we had a room street side (on Pike) we did not find the traffic noise too unbearable. The suite was large and comfortable with a full fridge, microwave, two burners, sink, dishes, utensils and appliances. Ice machine location was quite inconvenient. Unfortunately the hotel allows smoking so either the smoke or the powerful chemical "cover-up" fragrance attacked you in the hallway. This is the reason I went 4 stars on cleanliness otherwise it was superb. The free breakfast (every day) and dinner (Mon to Thurs) with beer and wine was a pleasant extra. Local newspaper and free internet were appreciated. The staff were friendly and provided great service and advice. Flat rate by taxi from the airport to the hotel is $32 and once at the hotel they have a shuttle for various locations downtown. This location is ideal and we walked to the convention centre two blocks away, Key Arena, Pike Place Market, and around downtown. The spacious suite was comfortable for three of us with a separate bedroom with a king bed and a queen fold out couch in the living room. I highly recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Could have moved into Homewood Suites on Pike”
Reviews.Author: vafrica
Reviews.Content: Honestly, if I didnt have a job to go home to I could have easily moved into this place! Rooms were very spacious and spotless. The breakfast had plenty of choices, the staff were helpful and always had a smile when approached. The location is great for the convention centre and downtown shopping and its about a 15-20 minute walk to the Pike Market. I asked for a quiet room facing the inner courtyard and received just that so, no street noise whatsoever. The Welcome Home reception held on weekdays was such a great thing - it absolutely made my day after a long day at work and it really did feel like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shemarall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. Took Amtrak from Vancouver BC. We called ahead and the hotels free shuttle was there to pick us up. Check in/out was a breeze. Staff was great. Inclusive breakfast was fantastic, more than I expected. The only complaint was the coffee.. it could have removed paint. The free shuttle to some of the major city attractions was easy to book and we never had to wait long for it. Unfortunately no shuttle to the pier but the front desk called a taxi for us while we had breakfast. Our room was very clean. The beds were very comfortable....even the hide-a-bed. The hotel was busy as it was a big football weekend but was still quiet. Would definitely recommend it...in fact, I already have.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hellfire500
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommendable if coming to Seattle for tourism purposes. Staff were courteous on arrival. My room was not a suite - just a basic room with a kingsize bed. The room wasn't huge but was an adequate size and was quite cozy. It had a balcony and all the usual amenities (fridge, safe etc) and the Internet connection was free. Location of this hotel is perfect - 1-2 min walk to the main shopping area of Pike Street, the bus tunnel is opposite the hotel and it is a short walk to the Seattle Center monorail. The only very slight negative point is that it is situated on a hill (not a steep one though).

Reviews.Title: “disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: hapimama
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its location downtown. Parking was $25 extra. The valet was hurried and rude. Our tv didn't work which they did fix when asked. Our phone never worked. Loud sirens were heard outside as was the tv of our neighbor - not ideal with a baby. We missed the free breakfast because it closed at 10am on a Sunday, for crying out loud! We arrived at 10:02 and everything was packed up and gone - so obviously they started clearing it out before 10am. We were not warned about breakfast times by check-in staff. Because they only had a few rooms left, we spent about $300 with taxes for a one night stay. Needless to say, I expect a lot more for that price: very disappointing and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great hotel experience; I was sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: jake100000000
Reviews.Content: I was sent to Seattle on business but stayed a week afterward to see the sights. My work booked me at Homewood Suites so I thought to make things easier I'd continue staying there for my vacation. Great choice!! The suite I was staying in was large, clean, comfortable and bright. Internet was fast and easy to hook up to. Bed and all linens were incredibly clean and crisp. The full size fridge kept everything icy cold. Two burner stove I never used, but could have with the supply of pots and pans and cutting boards and glass tupperware (and a full size dishwasher to clean them all after). The huge microwave had one of those easy 60 second heat buttons for my coffee. The coffee station they had set up had really interesting teas in it, as well as a microwave popcorn that came in handy a few nights. Bathroom toiletries were all Nutrogena and smelled great. Good hair drier, iron and ironing board, everything working and neat and in great shape. Outside the room things were great as well. The gym was clean with good equipment, the pool was especially awesome and the 24 hour a day free Starbucks coffee station was a godsend! Every time I entered or left the hotel I got a hot coffee to bring up to the room or out into Seattle in my travel mug. Delicious stuff, too. The breakfasts were surprisingly nice and not at all the dried out stuff you get in most hotels. Great view from the tables and the staff kept everything topped up and warm. No one had a problem with me grabbing some scrambled egg and sausage in a paper coffee mug and taking it out with me to eat in my room or on the go outside. I wasn't expecting everything to be quite so convenient and comfortable. I almost never notice hotels as they blend one into another, but this place really stood out in its comfort and smooth running. Finally, the staff was so positive and helpful. In contrast to many hotels I've stayed in over the years, the staff here was was really accommodating. They would give directions, advice about the best way to get somewhere by rail or car, how long it would take, where to eat for a specific type of food, etc. When my flight necessitated a late check out they were immediately fine with that, too, and - with a smile! - issued me a new room key that was programmed to work for an extra hour or so. Overall excellent experience and I will definitely stay there again when I return to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, and good location”
Reviews.Author: akheila
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days prior to our cruise and a night after the cruise, and it was perfect. I was a little worried the location was far from things, but in fact it was very close. Many things were very close by, and the free shuttle was handy too. We called from our ship as we were docking and asked about luggage storage until check in, the staff were amazing, they had us checked in the minute we arrived from our ship. It looked at first as though we would have to wait till later, but a room came available as we were talking to the front desk staff. It was an upgrade to the executive level, if we didn't mind...um sure didn't :) The room was clean, updated and very spacious. the linens were quite nice. Some people have mentioned some noise from the outside, we didn't find this a problem but they had earplugs on the nightstand if you felt you needed them. Anytime I hear anyone going to Seattle I will totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: rollingstoneDubai
Reviews.Content: I have been a HIlton Honors member for many years .This was the first time I chose to stay in A HOMEWOOD SUITES property.. Best decision I took. Its a great hotel , well located and the service levels excellent .. I was pleasantly surprised that this property even offers "dinner' on the house for guests . the ameneties , the beds and the space was just great . I will be now looking for HOME WOOD options in other places I visit in the future .

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mh_dlh
Reviews.Content: Hi there, Last year I stayed in the wonderful city of Seattle. My second time in the Hilton Homewood Suites Hotel on Pike Street. The Hotel had been refurbished in 2008. The entrance area is very nice and stylish. During weekdays Monday - Thursday complimentary diner is served with Wine & Beer included. The breakfast is very delicious, though I stayed 2 weeks the choices becomes thinner, but I assume this is everys hotel problem. The staff was very friendly and its walking distance to all ameneties within Seattle. To Pike Street Market you simple exit the hotel and go left, until the end of the road. There are also Hotel Shuttles within the city available. I would definately recommend this hotel. The only downside is the I5 just next to it. So if you can, get a room towards the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travel280
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for business and all major hotels were booked up. I booked the Homewood Suites and it was a very nice surprise. Amazingly clean, comfortable room, full kitchen. Location is perfect. Just a short walk to Westgate mall. Will definitely stay hrere if I return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT Hotel on many levels!”
Reviews.Author: spunkymom2
Reviews.Content: I booked this stays for this hotel pre- and post- cruise and we had a wonderful stay. With 3 adults and 2 children, we were able to get the 2 queen suite and we were pleasantly surprised at how spacious the suite was. We did not feel like we were crowded at all. The first room we had which was away from the elevators was a bit roomy than the one closer to the elevators but still only slightly. The beds were comfortable, the sofa bed was standard not the most comfortable but good enough for our stay. We felt very welcomed from the moment we walked in. The bellhop met us outside with the luggage trolley and brought our luggage straight our room with a very friendly welcome. The front desk were always courteous and helpful with directions and getting us taxis or info. Very efficient. The complimentary shuttle service was very helpful when we couldn't make the walk back from Pike St. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. Our children love the selection of the hot breakfast and of course, the waffle maker. The whole atmosphere of the hotel is calming and comfortable. And the location of the hotel was a huge plus. It was a nice walk to Pike Place Market and local transit such as the monorail and the city bus. Thus, no need for a car rental for our stay. I was also pleasantly surprised at the reasonable rates we received, which is well worth every dollar especially with our party for 5. Thank you so much for a wonderful vacation! We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS book me there!”
Reviews.Author: busyofficegoddess
Reviews.Content: The hotel where the conference my boss was attending was already booked. Homewood Suites on Pike Street was recommended by the CSR at the conference hotel. (She gets a Gold Star for being helpful!) I noticed it served breakfast (a definite plus); I also noticed that there was a "Welcome Home!" Manager's offering at the end of the day. Wow, I thought. This might just work. And work it did. When I asked for his receipts for meals from this trip, he said, "I don't have any! The hotel you booked for me took care of everything. That place was GREAT!" He liked everything, including the 5 or so blocks he had to walk to the conference. I have decided that, going forward, if there is a Homewood Suites Hilton anywhere my bosses have to travel, that's where they'll be staying. Thank you, Homewood Suites on Pike Street for making me look good and for making my boss so happy!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch! Great location - loved the breakfast & evening meal!”
Reviews.Author: khonermeadows
Reviews.Content: Our room was so clean - i actually took a jacuzzi bath! I NEVER do that! Great view - even with the highway - loved the location - took the light rail to westlake center and walked to the hotel - four days later when we traveled - the Hertz place was a block away... Grabbed a bus to the Boeing factory - walked to public market (and everywhere else) - walked to monorail to get over to Experience Music Project, Space Needle, etc. Enjoyed a glass of merlot everynight at the complimentar Manager's Meal - and had some food while we were at it - all four of us are vegetarians (2 teen boys) but there was enought o take the edge off before we headed out for the evening. Staff was just fine. Cyberdogs was a buzz for the kids. We all LOVED this place - on our 2 week tour - this was the favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: crosbieclan
Reviews.Content: If you want service at a great hotel for a reasonable price this is the place to stay in Seattle. On Pikes Place it is easy to get to where you want to go on the bus line or use the friendly hotel shuttle. We needed to switch our rooms and they never made us feel like we were asking too much. The staff were AMAZING! I would stay there again in a heart beat. Rooms were nice and the price was right! The only down side to giving them a good review is the desire to keep this gem a secret to our selves.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service & nice location!”
Reviews.Author: maconMouse
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here in a suite with a friend, and I can't say enough great things about the friendly & helpful staff of this hotel. From the moment I checked in, they made sure my stay was a great one. Suite was spotless, very roomy, and included a cozy fire place, balcony, full kitchen, and nice bath amenities. Really enjoyed the huge breakfast offerings each morning, complimentary Starbucks 24/7, and nice fitness center. Easy walk down to famous fish market & plenty of great restaurants nearby Cheesecake Factory & Hard Rock Cafe. Will definitely stay here again upon return...a definite keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa248
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for a few days while visiting Seattle and had a wonderful experience. The staff was exceptional - ALWAYS very professional and courteous. The rooms were great; open, spacious and modern, and the fireplace was a nice bonus. Perfect for taking off the slight chill on rainy Seattle days. I definately would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: hygieneLangley_WA
Reviews.Content: Superb suite - clean, new, spacious, everything I needed in kitchen, bathroom, HUGE bed, and everyone so friendly and helpful - oh yes, great breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: travel277
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a $12 taxi ride from Pier 91. We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. We had a 7th floor suite. The windows were closed, but there was a draft and the traffic noise sounded very clear. That was because the windows didn't fit the frames completely in both the living room and the bedroom. That's why I couldn't sleep on both nights. The sheets were thick and seemed like good quality, but they felt kind of rough. Since it's a Homewood, the hotel room set was nice and convenient with a stove, microwave, sink, fridge, and dishwasher. They provide pots, pans, and dinner ware. It would have been nice to buy fresh crab, fish, fruits, and vegetables from the market . There is a fitness center with a stationary bike, treadmill, elliptical machine, and benches for free weights. The billiards room is fun and has a leather couch with tv. They serve a generous breakfast, so the dining area was bustling around 9:30 am. The business center has two computers and is in the dining area. They provide free rides in the Homewood van, which is a Ford Flex. There are several drop-off points, including the International District and the Public Market, but they pick you up where they dropped you off. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk down to the Public Market. There are lots of shops and Starbucks along the way. The hotel provides umbrellas if you need one. Of course, it rained both days we were there. Finally, it costs $32 flat for a taxi ride from the hotel to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: FlynnsterSanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the way north to Vancouver and we could not have been more pleased. We arrived early due to our flight schedule, but they did not bat an eye and got us right into our room, which was clean, comfortable with all of the amenities we could want. The location was perfect for all of the activities we wanted. On our way south we stayed at the other Homewood on Western Ave and what a disaster! Pike Street Homewood is the best location, best service, and best value for the money. The free breakfasts and dinners we perfect for fast and furious site seeing. Anytime we are in Seattle, this is where we are staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie4701
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights en route from Australia to Anchorage. The room was lovely - very spacious and comfortable. The bed had the best mattress I have ever slept on. Very good value for money as an enormous buffet breakfast is complimentary as well as an evening meal including wine and beer. The majority of the staff we encountered in our five days were friendly but not very knowledgeable about touristy things so we had to source general tourist information from other avenues. Initially we had only booked 3 days but decided on the second day to extend the stay for another 2 days. The staff member we encountered was not very helpful especially when we were told the tariff would increase by $40 per night for the extra two nights. She certainly was not interested in extending any concession or explanation to us. We found this particular staff member to be quite uninterested in anything we enquired about during the course of our stay. Otherwise the location is fantastic and the lodgings extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The accomdations were wonderful and the service was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: miracleschedules
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and the rooms were very clean. The breakfast and supper that were included in the cost was a delight. Instead of the "usual" breakfast we were treated to hot entrees: eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes and they also had cereal, all types of bread, fruit, and yogurt. It made an enjoyable start to the day. There was coffee and tea at all times and a wonderful dinner every night. But what makes this hotel extra special is the staff. If we needed anything; extra towels, blankets we received within a short time. All the staff were friendly and more than ready to help out and answer our questions whether it was where to catch transportation to sights to see. Kalvin was remarkable. He handled many different tasks and guests, sometimes several at the same time and always with a smile on his face. He went the extra mile to make sure as guests were well taken care of. He is a jewel and the hotel is so very fortunate to have him. This man will go far in the hospitality business and will be a definite asset to the hotel. Phala at the front desk was amazing and I watched her handle the many guests arriving or leaving all at the same time with a calm, professional and friendly manner. Never did she look stressed or anxious. She also is a definite asset to the hotel. I also want to mention Danielle, Terry, Scott and Timmy who were outstanding in their jobs. This hotel runs very well and their employees work together as a team, something you don't see very often anymore. I thanked as many people as I could for helping our family reunion be the special event it was. The General Manager should also be commended as a team only works well when the GM appreciates his employees and treats them with respect. This GM obviously does. Kalvin and Phala deserve to be commended for their hard work as do all the others. My hat off to a very very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is what a hotel should be like!”
Reviews.Author: mlmitchell30
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Seattle for the two days proceeding our cruise to Alaska at the Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center. We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and stayed in a King suite. The room had a bed room (separate), a living room/kitchenette, and a bathroom. We also had a balcony. I was impressed with them before arriving. My family needed a ride from the airport to the hotel and they hooked me up with a sedan. It was great to have the problem solved before getting there. WHen we arrived, they allowed us to leave our luggage with the bell boy. They locked it up and we were able to go down to Pike's Market (short 5-7 block walk). When we returned we were able to checked into our room early and it was beautiful. The room had soothing colors and modern furnishings. My kids shared the pull out bed in the living room and my husband and I enjoyed the King size bed. The bed linens were wonderful - soft and crisp. The balcony was a wonderful bonus. While the kids were watching tv in the living room, husband in the bed room, I was able to read on the balcony. The front desk was great with recommendations for restaurants, band aides (husband tripped over the coffee table), and hailing a taxi to get us to the pier. They also have a great morning buffet and coffee in the lobby round the clock. Their location was awesome. We walked to Pike's market, the Seattle Museum of Art, and the Space Needle. I would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay yet”
Reviews.Author: boatingpauly
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle every year and I stay at the Homewood Suites on Pike Street every time, I've never ever had a problem and the staff and everything about the hotel is positive. Everyone is friendly there, the breakfest and the Happy Hour are just the frosting on the cake, the rooms are always clean and the staff is always there to help when needed. I will tell all my friends to stay there, I'll be back there in August and I will once again stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would return if this hotel was in another city!”
Reviews.Author: tenith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 2 nights for our first trip to seattle. We were upgraded to a suite on the 9th floor. The room was very spacious- an apartment with separate bedroom and kitchen, modern and clean. It was a little frustrating that we had to take 2 elevators to the room- the ninth floor has a separate elevator. A small dinner was served on the second night of our stay but we opted to dine out instead. Breakfast is served daily, free wifi and valet parking. The location is good only a short walk to downtown shops and pike place market. We took the monorail to the space needle- very underwhelmed. There are many homeless everywhere which I wasn't expecting. We went to see Nada Surf at Crocodile (Nada Surf were great)- rudest staff every- particularly the gross guys on the door- actually most people in Seattle were rude something I wasn't prepared for given the nice people everywhere else we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BluesChick2
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and roomy. What you would expect from any other Homewood Suites. Nice big sitting area with a decent size bedroom and bathroom. The kitchenette was useful. Our room had a gas fireplace. The building was once a semi-custom condo building so I think some of the rooms might have a little something extra. Our room also had a balcony. Not sure if that's standard. Our room faced I-5 which didn't bother me. It was actually kind of nice to have a little white noise to sleep with. If vehicles drving at high speed bother you, bring some Ambien. I rarely heard sirens and was never woken up by the street noise. It was very comfortable to sleep here. We were by the elevators and I never heard a sound. The happy hour was a nice snack. I wouldn't really want to eat a full meal here. Seemed like Trader Joe's frozen food and salad in a bag. But not bad for a hotel happy hour. Beer on tap was Miller Lite. I went to The Pike at Pike Place Market for beer instead. They had a couple of wines but I didn't look at the selection. Breakfast was what you would expect from a hotel breakfast. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pankaces, french toast, make your own waffle, cereal, bagels, english muffins, yogurt, coffee, etc. Nothing special but a nice start to the day. The location is great. About a ten minute walk to Pike Place Market. If you're in town for a convention, the convention center is about a block away. The monorail station is four or five blocks away so it was easy to get to the Space Needle and EMP. The hotel shuttle took us to a Marniers game so we saved on transportation to the game. Lots of restaurants a few blocks away. My only complaint about the location is that there seemed to be a large amount of homeless in Seattle. This is obviously no fault of the hotel. Pretty much anywhere you stay around here, you will encounter them. I also noticed a shocking lack of police presence. Even saw a drug deal go down outside the convention center. I recommend traveling in "packs" at night instead of alone. The big negative to this hotel is the parking cost. I think it was $20/day. Kind of pricey in my opinion. Had a great stay and would stay here again if I'm ever in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised!”
Reviews.Author: Jaypiddy1
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Homewood Suites in Beltown and made the change to the one at the convention centre just to switch things up a bit and the reviews and pictures mentioned a recent renovation. We had fantastic service, spotless room and a great free daily breakfast. We got an amazing price due to the fact that we prepaid and it was worth at least one third more if you ask me. Huge rooms with a kitchen, two name brand flat screen tv's and a bedroom to boot. This is our new go to place while staying in Seattle. My only complaint is that the parking is a bit spendy because of it's proximity to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly staff.. a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ABCFDC
Reviews.Content: The suite was roomy and clean and the bathroom was spacious. My husband I loved the full breakfast served each morning and the evening meals served Monday thru Thursday. The evening meals were surprisely very good! Complements to the chef. The only thing we would recommend is that they add a dessert to the evening meal. We loved the convenience of having FREE internet access right in our room. The hotel's location was great - right in the heart of things. The hotel's staff were very frendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: ramblinman58
Reviews.Content: Spot on hotel. Massive room with great views, great management and staff, excellent location. We shopped, went to a baseball game, went to the Pike Market, and took the Clipper home, which is close by. Handy shuttle service, and cheap for cab trips. Breakfast was a definite bonus. Loved our entire stay and have not one remotely negative thing to say. We will definitely stay here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: bigsun22245
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend and my stay was pretty good. The hotel itself is very nice, new rooms and furnishings, breakfast was great, and I appreciate the complimentary shuttle to baseball games and other attractions. We had issues with our air conditioner several times over the weekend, someone always came up to look at it quickly but it seemed to stop working again within a few hours. Luckily it wasn't too hot this weekend so the room was still livable. The staff here are amazing for the most part. There was only one bad experience I had with them, but it was bad enough for me to come here to write about it. There was a girl at the front desk (she did not have a nametag that I saw) who seemed to be there every time I called or came downstairs, and she obviously did not want to be at work. Saturday afternoon I came down to ask about the shuttle, both of the other people at the front desk were helping other guests, but this girl was too busy loudly complaining about her boyfriend going into drug rehab (?) and saying that she didn't want to be there, to answer my questions. I stood there for awhile and she never even said anything to me even though she wasn't doing anything and I ended up being helped by another front desk employee. She used the f word within earshot of me several times while I was standing there, and rolled her eyes when the other employees asked her to help them out since they were busy. This happened two more times when I came to the front desk, this same girl refused to even make eye contact with me even though she wasn't busy and I had to wait for another employee to finish up with the customer they were helping. We were in the shuttle with another group of people who were complaining that they had similar service from her, and saying that she had been sarcastic and rude to them, so it wasn't just me. Other than that one employee, we did have a great stay. All of the other staff members were great, valets, shuttle drivers, breakfast workers, front desk, even the guy who kept fixing our a/c was great. We would love to come back next time we stay in Seattle (GO MARINERS!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wiscob
Reviews.Content: We had an extra night in town and were not happy with our previous discount hotel. We found this place in the phonebook and gave it try. The room was pleasent and spacious with fantastic decor. It was within walking distance of Pike's Market, which was a plus as driving (and parking) in Seattle can be unplesant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. After checkout we wanted to spend a few hours in town and the parking attendant let us keep our vechile parked free of charge and even kept our luggage locked in the valet closet until we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit tad pricey”
Reviews.Author: bebeluv
Reviews.Content: Love the location since it's walking distance to shopping and Pike's Market. However the rooms were a bit pricey for our likes. Although what would you really expect with a suite and a prime location? Didn't really like the $25 parking charge and the layout of the parking garage. But those are the little disadvantages. The advantages however over power the disadvantages. The staff were friendly and helpful. They had a complimentary breakfast not to fancy but we were full and everyone's tummies were all satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: WATravelers005
Reviews.Content: We booked a one room suite for SakuraCon at the convention center. We had a 3 minute walk, very convenient. Parking garage was tight but had a valet option. We got our room very early - the staff was very pleasant. Free breakfast buffet - nice seating area. The room was nice - on the courtyard side, so no exposure to street noise. A small balcony, but too cold to use. We were fishbowled with other apts, condos and hotels, but this is downtown Seattle so... Our room was very cold. A call to maint got a response in about 7 minutes. He was helpful and friendly and fixed the problem right away. We had a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, two burners and a microwave. Cupboards were stalked with dishes for four. The bathroom was huge, and well laid out for morning preparations. Master had a big screen (as did living room) and a nice view of courtyard. Overall, the stay was great. My only negatives were the fridge and heating were older, so the off and on noise throughout our stay was noticable. And the sleeper sofa in the living room was a huge disappointment - mattress was super thin. We ended up putting the mattress on the floor rather than fight with the bar in the back. We will book here again for next year, but will try for a two queen size beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: terps1962
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write a review while currently staying at a hotel (day 3 of 6), but I'm sitting at the hotel computer, so I thought, why not. I'm a Hilton person, so I wanted to stay at a Hilton property. Used my points, so the stay was free. If I had to pay for this room, I might not have stayed. While the staff was great, the room itself was not. Even though we were on the 9th floor, it was extremely noisy outside. We were not facing Pike, but you could hear a LOT of traffic. They do have inside courtyard rooms, but that was not originally offered. The next day, I went down to the front desk to ask about anything facing inwards and they offered up another room. It wasn't as big as the first room and my wife decided not to move, so we stayed in the noisy room. Again, staff was trying to accommodate, so I'm not blaming them. Another problem with the room was the condensation in the windows. You wake up and there is a puddle of water on the window sill. I travel all the time and have never seen that. Breakfasts are fine and my boys are enjoying the billiards room. Wife likes the fitness room. If it wasn't for the noise, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: LambandLion-Fish
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in downtown, and we (his 6-month-pregnant wife and our 22-month-old toddler) traveled with him. We liked everything about the hotel. The breakfast was excellent (although a bit crowded). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our suite was very spacious (huge!). The bed was comfortable. Very nice place to stay at even with a growing family. Only thing I would change: I would put out the high chairs (don't keep them in a separate room for employees) so that families don't have to request it every time they want to eat there. With a morning crowd and a fussy toddler this would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Rich47048
Reviews.Content: Spacious suite, fully functional kitchen, hearty breakfast and weekday dinner to boot, what's not to like.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suites and happy hour”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Terriific location in central Seattle, close to Conv center, hospitals and short walk to Pike St Market.

Reviews.Title: “Just missed 'Perfect'”
Reviews.Author: BritBoyInFL
Reviews.Content: Great location aided by the hotels free 'on demand' shuttle to various locations around town. Basically the hotel delivered on everything they promised, with one exception. Their sound proofing on rooms facing the freeway is less then required. Simply put, I think the quality of their glazing is poor, too much noise is allowed in from outside. I was on the 8th floor and it still sounded like the window was open ! It didn't cause me to lose any sleep, but I can imagine it would be a problem for others. I have stayed in many, many other hotels which were located in far noisier locations, but my room was much quieter. Breakfast is perfect, the free evening snack with wine or beer was great if you come back from work having skipped lunch. I was always greeted when returning to the hotel, which is a nice touch. The condition of the room fixtures and fittings, in my room, was excellent. Comfy bed, great pillows (Not those ones than deflate when you put your head on them), large refrigerator, microwave, breakfast counter, clean carpets, in short, just like a new home. As I said, 'Almost Perfect'.

Reviews.Title: “So nice to come "Home"wood to!”
Reviews.Author: Tutu247
Reviews.Content: First class. Fireplace, very clean rooms, bath with jacuzzi tub, cozy, comfortable beds and QUIET! Morning newspaper. Full Kitchen, but with the complimentary breakfast with fresh fruit, big selection of items and tasty dinners with wine, why cook? Meals were great and appreciated when getting to morning meetings. Business center to check messages. Staff friendly, shuttle accommodating and wish I would have the time to use the fitness center. Liked our first stay very much, the second time was just as nice. We are looking forward next. Great location by the convention center, Pike Street market and Cheese Cake Factory just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were comfortable and more than adequite for my needs”
Reviews.Author: Cremant
Reviews.Content: I really like the linen on the beds. The beds are confortable. Having a "kitchen" in the suite gives me a sense of being home when returning to the room after a long day. The location is on the edge of Seatle "coffee shop" neighborhood, so if late nights with great coffee and music are your thing, this place is walking distance. Parking is OUCH

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: RITA000
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. Kind people at every turn, Front Desk, Breakfast and Dinner greeters. I'll definetly return again and again. Terrific food at happy hour and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyinva
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I spent the night here before catching a plane to the east coast after week long business trip in a neighboring town. Once we arrived we were kindly greeted at the front desk and told that they were serving a complimentary dinner until 7PM with drinks included. Since it was close to 7 we enjoyed a free dinner before heading up to the rooms. Dinner was tasty and the beer was cold - no problem about coming back for seconds either - even for the beer. (Non alcoholic drinks available too) When I got to my room on the 5th floor I couldnt believe the room was so big. I think this was the first time in my life I have taken pictures of my hotel room. I wanted to show the wife and kids at home how nice this place was. Below are a few of the 20 or so pictures I took. The view from the 5th floor overlooked the street below and the interior of the city even though the pictures outside on the small balcony didnt turn out so good. I had planned to see a movie at the movie theater down the street a few blocks away before arriving that night but once I settled in I decided to enjoy the room with two HD tv's with Showtime and HD channels. Even though the noises of the city were outside the soundproofing of the doors and windows did a great job of blocking them. I had no problems sleeping until the alarm went off the next morning. Breakfast was also complimentary and had a huge assortment items to eat and juices, coffee, and hot chocolate. This again was the biggest "free" breakfast I have ever had as well. (No Contenintal Breakfast here) I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city of Seattle and if I get the chance to get back to Seattle for business or vacation I will be staying at Homewood Suites - Pike Street. I hope they won't be booked up.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: JeannineBaltimore
Reviews.Content: The perfect place for business or pleasure, walking distance from the beautiful Pike Street Market, resturants, bars, and shopping locations. The staff was amazing, especially Celine, such a great atmosphere, can't wait to visit this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to everything !!”
Reviews.Author: KM_Nick
Reviews.Content: This beautifull hotel on the Hill is a hidden suprise! Excelent Breakfast and Dinner included in the Price, an Awsome view of dowtown area that lights up at night. Dont rent a Car because you wont need it, a very short walk to Movies, restruants, shopping and night life. Lets keep this Hotel a secret, just between you and me, OK? KM Road Warrior Nick Ferrendelli

Reviews.Title: “The hotel room was great with good breakfasts and dinners”
Reviews.Author: iclarabelle001
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent, with good views, comfortable beds and a kitchen with all the needed dinnerware was supplied. The breakfasts were yummy and the dinners and drinks were great. I would recommend this hotel with great pleasure. The staff was friendly and helpful. Thank you for a great 4 day stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: kcbusiness
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I enjoy staying at this hotel because it offers several of the comforts of home (kitchenette, office area and living room) in a great location in the city. The hot breakfast and happy hour meals are a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Whoba
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, great amenities, close to several excellent restautants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: missyellowbird
Reviews.Content: This is second time I've stayed at this hotel ... both times, the staff have just been wonderful. Staying at this hotel is the highlight of my trip down in Seattle (of course, besides learning my job).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: NJtravel099
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business convention. Hotel is just a few blocks from the convention center. It's a very nice facility, and I had a lovely one bedroom suite, with a huge bathroom, balcony, and fireplace. There is a small work out room, but no pool. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were all very helpful and polite. Be warned, it is a fairly long walk to the Market and downtown areas. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with excellent, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: hidkitty
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Homewood Suites for their convenient locations and the Seatlle hotel on Pike provided just that! Their staff is professional, courteous and attentive. My stay was brief, but the conveniences provided in the room along with the light meal service available helped make me feel comfortable and able to rest, relax and hit the road the next day! I've already passed along recommendations to my friends regarding this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: HowBOUTthemCOWBOYS01
Reviews.Content: My wife and i thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Homewood suites. We came down to Seattle from Vancouver for the final Seahawks game of the season. We were treated excellently as soon as a i valeted our vehicle. There was a shuttle waiting to take us to the game which would have picked us up after if we had not wanted to wander. All staff were very friendly and willing to help. We received 4 star treatment at 3 star price. I will definitely book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites' staff were the most accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: treeladyHonolulu
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient to everywhere downtown. The complimentary shuttle service made it even easier to get around. Breakfasts offered something for everyone. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably your best value weekend choice for Emerald City exploring”
Reviews.Author: 1StepBeyond7
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned travelers, but we're also from the Puget Sound area, so it was quite a challenge to "choose a home base place" for a small Seattle Downtown movie, dinner, romance adventure (on a budget) for our anniversary eve (we were married in Seattle and stayed at one of the large, but very nice "corporate" hotels, the Westin for that special evening...) Homewood (now a Hilton after being called Pike Place Suites and Summerfield under previous nameplates) quite simply was the best overall value we could find, and WE really knew where and what to look for. Its location is outstanding for walking, exploring and being right in the thick of the things most really want to "see" in Seattle. And if you need to go further, it's ideally situated to do it from. "Top Marks" for: Front Desk friendliness/knowledge, Engineer (we had a door lock glitch, so they gave us a quick upgrade 'til getting the room back open), Location (They are easy off I-5 and away from a lot of the one-way hassles of downtown) besides their valet during the week you may get lucky like us and find free parking across the street - from late Saturday through Sunday when meters are off) they're one block from the Wa State Conv Ctr if that's of interest, and only 3 blocks or so from the Regal Theater complex and literally scores of great local and chain restaurants and shops. Finally, it's a straight shot right down Pike about 9 easy blocks to the Pike Place Market "pig" entrance. "Good Job"s for: Rooms (a bit tired, but nice kitchens, baths, furnishings and comfy Hilton beds), Exercise Room with water cooler, towels, TV and some weights, plus 2xTreadmills, 2xEllipticals, 1 Recumbent Bike - all NEW Precor with Cardio Theater TV's and near-pro gym quality) "Hot" Breakfast (better than Denny's but not quite up to Embassy Suites standards - but the price- Free - was right!), Shuttle Service (we didn't use but it was a great itinerary and they were flexible about pick-ups until around 9 pm. Great if you are tired after walking all over the city. Biggest Surprise: The price, just over $100 incl. tax for an admittedly quiet night, just after New Year's. The Last Words...This is a great place to stay if you want a quiet and close-by hotel to kick back (even play pool in their lounge!), with a weekday manager's reception, and to keep some food, drink around your room (big fridge, a microwave and a stovetop, plus a coffee maker and the bonus - Starbucks coffee always hot in the lobby, incl. real creamer. You can buy munchies from their quick selection but there are markets everywhere, including a fairly close QFC supermarket up on Capitol Hill, a mini mart by the Conv. Ctr. and a nice IGA with decent wine prices right down on 3rd Ave. off Pike. If you want to work out and not pay extra, it's a 24-hour fantastic value - so pick the "off-times" to avoid any crowds and get a real workout incl. in your room price. Or just head down the hill, to Pike Place, Pioneer Square, or the waterfront. You'll be walking lots, especially back up the hill to the hotel, but there's lots of food and drink along the way to cure what "ales" you... "Top Tips" nearby from a Local "Tourist": Pike Place Pub for beer and magnificent crab-stuffed Salmon filet. Everything's wild, food is best quality, beer brewed there has won awards. McCormick and Schmick's...great drinks, consistently better seafood, reasonable wine list values. Key Lime Pie that is more like cheesecake but puts others to shame! Avoid Rock Bottom, Tap House Grill has a great selection though...Want to see Seattle and its environs from the water - try Argosy Cruises, a family-owned company, and always focused on service and true value. or just hop a WS Ferry!

Reviews.Title: “we would always stay in this hotel when we are in seattle”
Reviews.Author: DowntownSeattle
Reviews.Content: a hotel of choice if traveling with family. we loved the rooms with a kitchen. best of all the hotel had free breakfast and free dinner. the front desk staff was wonderful. free shuttle to nearby downtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home and more”
Reviews.Author: solo-traveller1209
Reviews.Content: I arrived on an early flight & arrived at the hotel just after 9am. The front desk staff welcomed me and immediately found me a suite even though check-in is not until 4pm! The complimentary breakfast was still open so I was also invited to enjoy breakfast! I couldn't have felt more welcome. The suite was spacious, clean and fully equipped. It was located away from the noisy Pike Street side. The breakfast had many selections both hot & cold and the evening reception was also substansial and included a selection of beer or wine. I noticed many families enjoying eating together morning and evening. The location was central and right next to the convention centre with its great free art exhibit . Great shopping and Pike Place Market are within walking distance. It was also within easy walking distance of the new SoundLink Light Rail station at Westlake Centre that connects with SeaTac airport for $2.50 one way

Reviews.Title: “Suite with kitchen for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: PatriceYVR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel. When I arrived, an employee wanted to make me sign a registration for the parking. I said no because he intended me to pay the parking location. Then I checked in at the reception. The only blame that I'd do is that the desk clerk, a young blond girl, was speaking quickly even after asking several times to speak more slowly, it seemed to be a tremendous and impossible effort to make. When I checked the room, there was a draft in the windows because it was not properly fixed. So I asked a new room to the girl. And she gave me an upgraded room, a suite for the same price. The bedroom and the living room were separate. There was also a kitchen with microwave, fridge, dishes, coffee maker, cutlery, a sink, cupboards, a cork screw and so on. Wonderful. The living room has a couch, a tv and a fireplace with a false fire. I think it's the best hotel I've ever seen for the price which was fair for a spot in the downtown very close. The breakfast was correct. You can make yourself your waffles. There is a fitness center and a pool. Free internet. I think the hotel is very interesting to stay because you can cook and you are like in a true apartment. I would say though the desk clerk was nice with me and professional. So the next time, when I will come back, smile and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Danielle, Dionne and Anthony, WORST STAFF EXPERIENCE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: lisakjack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Saturday, Dec 5th. While the hotel nice and clean, good location. When I called down to ask when breakfast ended on Sunday morning at 5 after 10, I was told "it is over". When I asked if they could please save something and I'd be right down, DANIELLE at the front desk was RUDE and said, no, it's over. I asked to speak to the manager, who turned out to be another front desk person, Dionne. I was ill that day and called back in about an hour to ask to extend my stay and was told "no", because the front desk felt I was rude on the phone! I asked to speak to a manager again, and was given a "cell" phone number for "Anthony". When I called this number all I got was a voicemail. Checkout was 1pm. At 12:30, Dionne bangs on my door to remind me of checkout at 1PM. I was only able to call the customer service line, in DALLAS, TX! This was of no help. This staff basically kicked me out of the hotel over a phone call to ask about breakfast! I was alone, not making any noise and was ILL! I should not have even driven home that day. This was the worst hotel STAFF experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: wednesdayschild
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a great one-night stay here. This hotel has the best price-to-value ratio in downtown Seattle. The room rate includes a lot of extras, e.g. the shuttle that takes you to all the tourist spots, wi-fi, hot breakfast & happy hour. Did I forget anything? Oh, use of the billards room is included as well. The location looks a bit far away from Pike Place Market on a map but it's an easy 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Less than 5 minutes in, this walk will take you thru the most vibrant part of the downtown core on Pike Street. My suite was comfortable, well-appointed, and most importantly clean as a whistle--particularly the bathroom! Another big plus is the super-friendly and efficient staff: check-in was smooth and gracious, and the staff who maintained the breakfast area seemed genuinely happy to be of service. Breakfast was substantial and hearty, although the hot foods could have been a little hotter. All in all, a terrific stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever!!”
Reviews.Author: peacefulmind
Reviews.Content: I had read great reviews about this hotel so decided to book it. This was a business/leisure trip to Seattle. My husband was on a business trip and my toddler and I tagged along.
