We arrived at the hotel 10 am but the room wasn't ready and were told to come back at 4 pm although we didn't start on a very good note, as the gentleman at the front desk wasn't very nice specially considering that we had a small child and had been flying for 4 hours and tired. We were told to call back and find out if the room gets done sooner. I wish he had offered to call us instead as we were brand new in the city. However that didn't stop us from spending our entire day exploring downtown, walking down the Pike place market and also did the duck tour. When we got back we were greeted with smiles by 2 young ladies. Our room was clean, spacious, facing the street ( as we requested) and had a crib for our toddler. They served breakfast every morning which was really fresh and tasty and I am talking about 'real' breakfast. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, milk, cereal, fruits, yogurt, coffee and more. I mean do we every go in such detail every day to prepare our breakfast at home. I thought that was great. The staff was super friendly right from the maids, to front desk, to shuttle driver to managers themselves. They have a laundry and a suite shop. They have a reception light dinner every evening. My husband and I thought the light dinner every night with wine and beer was the best touch ever. We loved how managers would interact with guest and be there for dinner. It was a different meal every day. After working all day my husband loved to unwind with a glass of cold beer. It worked out really good for us because with a toddler we couldn't venture out for dinner every night for 6 days. This was a fun way for us to enjoy ourselves in the comfort of our hotel. The hotel had a shuttle service which took guests to main tourist spots. I used it a few times during the day when my husband was gone to take my baby to the aquarium and children's museum. Our 5 day stay at Homewood suite was one of our best stays ever in any hotel. We travel a lot both domestic and international but never have experienced such great service. I may be wrong but one night for dinner reception the GM Greg was hosting it. He was very nice and friendly and we talked about some restaurants and cupcake shops. I thought it was very nice of a GM to be a part of his hotel team that way ( that is if he was the same Greg) My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel and even my super friendly toddler felt at home, She got smiles and compliments from all the staff members and I thought yes this sure is a kid friendly hotel :) I would recommend this hotel to any friend or family and can vouch for it. Let me assure ya'll this will be the best choice for a downtown hotel because of its location, friendly staff and service. You will not be disappointed. Have a fun stay!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MonaAlsaad
Reviews.Content: front desk and service were very helpful, positive, and friendly... suites are big with full amenities .. cleaning service depends on the cleaning lady, though mostly good.. location is very good, although it's a step from downtown, the area is not as busy as you might think. However, our room was overlooking Boren St. which was often occupied by passing ambulance (a bit noisy) ..the 9th floor corridors have a weird smell .. breakfast was neat with varieties that would please almost everybody. complementary dinner was also served though we never got to try it. I would like to thank all the staff for our pleasant stay and would definitely recommend it to friends and stay again there if i got to visit Seattle another time Mona Alsaad - Kuwait

Reviews.Title: “an excellent and less expensive option to a city centre hotel, yet only 3 blocks away”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at either the Sheraton or Hilton on 6th Avenue in the heart of the city. This trip I tried this new property and was very pleasantly surprised. It is only a 3 block walk up Pike St from the Sheraton. The price is much lower, as is the parking charge. The full hot breakfast was great and not offered at either the Sheraton or Hilton. Fully equipped kitchens where helpful as well. I've found a new favourite place to stay in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ragan10
Reviews.Content: The kitchen was big. I didn't feel crowded in the room at all. The staff would tell us the best location to go to on what night it is. When you come back into the hotel, they would smile and ask how your day is going.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surpirse!!”
Reviews.Author: RAC22
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay here because the reviews were not as good as I would like and I was worried about the freeway noise. I was staying on points so I needed to stay at a Hilton so I said, "Ok, so it won't be perfect." But what a surprise. The location of course is great. I asked for an inside room, I got a huge suite with a deck and full kitchen and balcony overlooking an inside courtyard. Must have just been remodeled. Granite counter tops, seven pillows on my bed, fireplace, flat screen TV in the living room, very modern. The weather was perfect in Seattle but the room so nice I just wanted to hang out in the room. I didn't - but almost wished for a rainy day. Plus, this was the only hotel in the world that I have stayed that the valet parking actually worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Night and day differance”
Reviews.Author: travelagentnancy
Reviews.Content: Recently after a miserable night at the Homewood Suites on Western, I moved to this fantastic hotel on Pike Street. The staff helped with this situation and were very professional AND always with a smile. The location was good, easy access to I-5, only 9 blocks from Pike's Market, walking distance to wholefoods, shuttle service to several locations in Seattle and one block from the Paramont theater. The rooms were wonderful, with flat screen TVs and lots of channels. Ask for an interior courtyard room, they are so quiet. The staff helped out with every request, even the breakfast staff which made the stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: VikeFanFJ
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel and it was great. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. The common areas are clean and quiet. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BonniebMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room and were very comfortable. The staff made sure we had everything we needed and were always friendly. The location is excellent because it is within walking distance to a lot of things. The breakfast each day was wonderful and we also liked the free food for happy hour in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with convenient, near-downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Dankaran
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location that's convenient to downtown without being right in it. It was about a 20 minute walk to Pike Place Market and about 15 minutes to the Space Needle. So, if you're looking to be right in the thick of the city with enless options right outside your door, this may not be the right place. However, being a little off the side, this neighborhood, which is near trendy Queen Anne, is a slightly more relaxed, neighborhood-feeling location. The room was good. It was large, roomy, and pleasant but unremarkable. Definitely a good value in what tends to be a very expensive city for hotels. The most outstanding feature of the hotel was the staff! When I arrived, the room I was supposed to be in was not ready. So, the extremely helpful front desk clerk not only worked very quickly to resolve the situation but offered a significant room upgrade. And, most importantly, I felt that he truly took pride in his business establishment and was willing to work to ensure that my needs as a customer were met.

Reviews.Title: “New Hilton Affiliation Not Working”
Reviews.Author: TC5903
Reviews.Content: Previously stayed at this location multiple times before ownership with Hilton (Homewood Suites) was established and received great service each time. This was my first stay since the ownership change and outside of a new lobby, I can not think of any improvements prompted by the change. I had repeated problems with the service. Unable to locate my reservation upon arrival. Pushed to the side by another incoming guest (apparently a returning & frequent guest that required service immediately). Placed in a room overlooking all night road construction. Wifi service was out throughout my stay. The hotel, of course, ran out of cables for hardwire computer access. Written comments on service delivered to the front desk the morning after my first night went unanswered by hotel management for a week. In summary, a nightmare of a stay (that I cut short and moved to another hotel). Considering the competition in Seattle hotels, I cannot in good conscience recommend this location (which I had done in the past for several years).
